0.title: Kohli is not far off from a real special innings: Vaughan
0.article_body: Michael Vaughan has said the "pinnacle point" in the upcoming three-match ODI series between India and England will be Virat Kohli. "India need Virat back to form. They need him to score runs...I've seen glimpses that he is not far off from a real special innings," he added. Kohli scored 1, 11 in recently concluded three-match T20I series against England.

1.title: Blinkit promotes long-time executive Rishi Arora to Co-founder: Report
1.article_body: Quick commerce startup, Blinkit, promoted long-time executive Rishi Arora to Co-founder, two months prior to its acquisition by Zomato, as per a report. Prior to this, Arora had been working as a senior Vice President of Operations for 8 years at the company. Blinkit has also named former Zomato Engineering Manager, Sajal Gupta, as the Chief Technology Officer (CTO).

2.title: You are creating history: PM to Shramjeevis building new Parliament
2.article_body: PM Narendra Modi interacted with workers involved in the construction work of the new Parliament and said that they're making history. "I had a wonderful interaction with the Shramjeevis who have been involved in the making of the Parliament. We are proud of their efforts and will always remember their contribution to our nation," PM Modi said in a tweet.

3.title: Huge flashlight caused by meteor seen in Chile's night sky, pic goes viral
3.article_body: A meteor was recently spotted causing huge flashlight through the night sky over Chile's Santiago. Academics at the Concepción University said that it was a small rock body that burned up upon entering the Earth’s atmosphere. According to local media, the bright flashes of light were accompanied with loud booming sounds.

4.title: Storage in dams supplying water to Pune city increases to 8.70 TMC
4.article_body: Storage in the dams supplying water to Pune city has risen to 8.70 TMC because of a good spell of rain for the last one week, officials said. More rains have been predicted for the next few days in the catchment area of these dams. The water storage was 8.63 TMC last year on the same day, according to officials.

5.title: 5 popular Delhi markets to be revamped, govt to conduct online survey
5.article_body: The Delhi government has begun preliminary work towards revamping five popular markets. The governments will be conducting an online survey of traders of all the five markets to take stock of facilities. Kamla Nagar, Sarojini Nagar, Khari Baoli spice market, Lajpat Nagar and Kirti Nagar furniture markets will be revamped under the project.

6.title: Dileep is innocent in 2017 actress assault case: Former Kerala DGP
6.article_body: Former Kerala Director General of Police Sreelekha claimed on her YouTube channel that Malayalam actor Dileep is 100% innocent and not at all involved in the 2017 actress assault case. Sreelekha further said most of the evidence against Dileep has been fabricated by co-accused Pulsar Suni and his "quotation gang". She alleged police helped Pulsar secure a mobile in prison.

7.title: Pune college introduces course on setting up terrace gardens
7.article_body: Pune's Modern College of Arts, Science and Commerce has decided to introduce a certificate course on setting up terrace gardens. The course will begin on August 15 and the registrations will start in the first week of August. Candidates will be chosen on a first-come-first-serve basis and the course will be open to all students, pensioners, working professionals and homemakers.

8.title: Bihar's Purnea alerted over reports of Nairobi fly attacks in Bengal
8.article_body: The Purnea health administration was on Monday put on high alert over reports of Nairobi fly attacks in Bihar through West Bengal. Medical officers have been directed to spread awareness about how to deal with possible attacks. On July 5, around 100 students of a college in Sikkim suffered from severe skin infections after coming in contact with the flies.

9.title: Heavy rain in Gujarat disrupts power supply in 174 villages
9.article_body: At least 174 villages across Gujarat lost power supply in the heavy rain that affected parts of Gujarat on Sunday. According to IMD, Chhota Udepur received over 166 mm of rainfall in the last 24 hours. This is the second-highest rainfall after the Narmada district, which received 168 mm in the last 24 hours, ending at 8 am on Monday.

10.title: SpiceJet refutes reports of surprise check by DGCA & windshield crack incident
10.article_body: SpiceJet on Monday refuted reports that claimed that the windshield of one of its aircraft cracked minutes after departure from Chennai, while another flight was delayed by six hours after DGCA’s surprise inspection. On July 9, media reports emerged that a SpiceJet flight from Mumbai to Srinagar was delayed for six hours because of DGCA's surprise audit of the aircraft.

11.title: 3 men, aged 22-26, drown in waterfall in UP's Mirzapur
11.article_body: Three young men drowned in the Chuna Dari waterfall in Uttar Pradesh's Mirzapur district. The waterfall was immediately closed for the tourists after the incident and rescue operations went underway, police said. The deceased, identified as Sandeep Kharwar (26), Prince (23) and Rishu (22), had come from Varanasi. Notably, the three deceased didn't know how to swim, police added.

12.title: 3 people gored during 5th bull run at festival in Spain's Pamplona
12.article_body: Three people were gored and three others were bruised during the fifth bull run at Pamplona's San Fermín Festival in Spain on Monday, a Spanish Red Cross spokesperson said. While there will be three more bull runs till Thursday, this is the first one in which someone was gored this year. One of the gored people is Australian.

13.title: Have over ₹2,800 cr in our bank yet we aren’t efficient: Unacademy CEO tells staff
13.article_body: In an internal note to the employees, Unacademy CEO Gaurav Munjal announced a series of cost-cutting measures. He said, "Even though we have over ₹2,800 crore in the bank, we aren't efficient at all...There are a lot of unnecessary expenses we do...We must turn profitable asap." "These changes might seem we are in a bad state...We are not," he added.

14.title: Russian shelling in Ukraine's Kharkiv killed 3, injured 31: Guv
14.article_body: Three people were killed and 31 others were injured due to shelling by Russian forces in Ukraine's Kharkiv, the regional governor claimed. The city's Mayor Ihor Terekhov said that the shelling hit places "which had no military significance". He added that two children aged four and 16 were among the people who were taken to a hospital.

15.title: Woman killed after jumping in front of metro in Kolkata, services disrupted
15.article_body: A woman died after jumping in front of an approaching metro train at Girish Park station in West Bengal's Kolkata on Monday. The incident occurred around 12:35 pm and metro services were disrupted for around 50 minutes. Officials said they are trying to identify the woman and find her family members. They are investigating the matter and checking CCTV footage.

16.title: No free meals for staff, founders & top management to take salary cut: Unacademy
16.article_body: In an internal note to the staff, Unacademy's CEO Gaurav Munjal said that firm's founders and top management will take pay cuts, and the company will also shut its global test preparation business in a bid to turn profitable. He also put travel restrictions on employees, removed dedicated drivers for CXOs and stopped complimentary meals and snacks at their offices.

17.title: Centre should invite Oppn to events related to Parliament: Ex-Cong MP
17.article_body: As PM Narendra Modi unveiled the National Emblem on the new Parliament building on Monday, ex-Congress MP Sandeep Dikshit said the Centre should invite Opposition leaders as well to the events and functions related to the Parliament. "The Parliament does not belong to a single party, government or a PM...It belongs to every elected member of the Parliament," he added.

18.title: We've stable govt, don't need anyone: Goa CM on Cong's defection accusation
18.article_body: After AICC Goa in-charge Dinesh Gundu Rao said a "conspiracy" was led by two of their leaders by "hobnobbing" with BJP to ensure defection in Congress in Goa, CM Pramod Sawant said, "We don't need anyone, we've a stable government with support of 25 MLAs." Furthermore, he said, "Since they (Congress) have nothing to do, they're doing this blame-game drama."

19.title: Delhi minister Satyendar Jain's judicial custody extended till July 20
19.article_body: A Delhi court on Monday extended Delhi Minister Satyendar Jain's judicial custody till July 20 in a money laundering case. ED has carried out at least two rounds of raids against his family members and associates. The probe agency claimed to have seized cash worth ₹2.85 crore and 133 gold coins after raids conducted against his family and others.

20.title: Suryakumar needed supporting role from someone in his 117-run innings: Sehwag
20.article_body: Ex-India opener Virender Sehwag has said Suryakumar Yadav needed "supporting role" from other batters in his 117-run innings in the third T20I against England. "Shreyas did support him for some time, but the batters after that did not give him company. Such a knock would have looked better if it was on the winning side," stated Sehwag. Shreyas scored 28(23).

21.title: TDP will back Murmu for Presidential polls: Chandrababu Naidu
21.article_body: Telugu Desam Party chief and former Andhra Pradesh CM Chandrababu Naidu said that his party will vote for NDA's Droupadi Murmu in the upcoming Presidential polls. Naidu said that it would be "wonderful to see her [Murmu]" become the first tribal woman President. With this, Andhra Pradesh's two main political parties, YSRCP and TDP, have declared to support Murmu.

22.title: Over 3,000 people evacuated amid heavy rains in Gujarat: Officials
22.article_body: Over 3,000 people have been evacuated from Gujarat as heavy rains lashed the state and the meteorological department's forecast showed that heavy to very heavy rainfall is likely to continue over the next five days in several districts. Officials said that 400 people have been evacuated from Chhotaudepur, which received 433 mm of rainfall in just 12 hours.

23.title: Who is Sneha Pareek, the only girl JEE Main 2022 topper who scored 300/300?
23.article_body: Out of the 14 students who scored 100 percentile in JEE Main 2022 Session 1, Guwahati’s Sneha Pareek is the only girl topper who scored 300/300. She wants to pursue BTech in Computer Science. "I'm willing to join any IIT that offers my desired course. If it comes as a preferred choice, I will opt for IIT-Bombay," she said.

24.title: 'Dhaakad' was removed from cinemas even before I could watch it: Saswata
24.article_body: Saswata Chatterjee, who was recently seen in Kangana Ranaut-fronted 'Dhaakad', has said he fails to understand why the movie didn't work. "It was a big project. It was removed from [cinemas]...even before I could watch it," he added. 'Dhaakad', which was made on an estimated budget of ₹85 crore, managed to earn only ₹2.58 crore in India, according to reports.

25.title: Abe killed by ex-serviceman, BJP playing with fire on Agnipath: TMC
25.article_body: The TMC has cautioned Centre over new military recruitment scheme Agnipath by pointing out that ex-Japan PM Shinzo Abe was assassinated by a short-service ex-serviceman. "BJP is playing with fire in the name of Agnipath...We have seen what...happened in Japan," TMC's Kunal Ghosh said. Abe's attacker reportedly lost his job in Japanese Maritime Self-Defence Force after three years of service.

26.title: Rupee closes at new all-time low of 79.44 against US dollar
26.article_body: The rupee ended at a new all-time low of nearly 79.44 per US dollar on Monday. The currency on Monday opened at 79.30 against the US dollar and witnessed an intra-day high of 79.24 and a low of 79.49. Meanwhile, BSE Sensex ended 86.61 points lower at 54,395.23, while NSE Nifty declined 4.60 points on Monday.

27.title: IFS officer shares video of cobra hiding in a shoe, says 'be careful in monsoon'
27.article_body: IFS officer Susanta Nanda has shared a video of a cobra hiding inside a shoe and tweeted, "You will find them at oddest possible places in monsoons. Be careful. Take help of trained personnel." The video showed the snake being rescued by a trained official, who advised people to always shake their shoes before wearing.

28.title: We weren't prepared for animal that it was: Ranbir on Brahmastra getting delayed
28.article_body: Ranbir Kapoor, while speaking about the delay in the release of 'Brahmastra', said, "I think when we started...[it], we weren't prepared for the animal that it was." "It had too many special effects...and where the story was, we didn't expect that...So we were learning as we were making it," he added. The film is scheduled to release on September 9.

29.title: Anil to host a Bohemian-themed baby shower for Sonam Kapoor: Report
29.article_body: Anil Kapoor and Sunita Kapoor will be hosting a  Bohemian-themed baby shower for their daughter Sonam Kapoor Ahuja, according to a report. The actress is expecting her first child with her husband Anand Ahuja. The baby shower will reportedly be hosted at Sunita's sister Kavita Singh's Rockdale mansion in Bandra, where Sonam and Anand Ahuja got married.

30.title: Vauld's users to continue earning interest on crypto FDs: CEO
30.article_body: Crypto lending platform Vauld's users will continue to earn interest on their fixed crypto deposits, its CEO Darshan Bathija confirmed. Bathija's clarification comes after the company suspended withdrawals and deposits citing volatile conditions in the crypto market. On resuming withdrawal deposit options, he said he can't provide fixed timelines yet but is working to resume operations soon.

31.title: 5-yr-old Mumbai boy falls to death from window of 11th-floor-flat
31.article_body: A five-year-old boy fell from the window of his 11th floor flat in a housing society in Mumbai's Byculla area on Sunday while he was playing with an umbrella, police said. The boy was near his bed and his mother and relatives were in the same room when the incident occurred in the morning, an official said.

32.title: Journalists barred from entering Odisha schools, Education Min criticises move
32.article_body: The Odisha government banned the entry of journalists into schools in some areas after news channels showed how students were poor in mathematics. Union Education Minister Dharmendra Pradhan criticised the move, saying the press is the fourth pillar of democracy and cannot be stopped from entering a public institution. The news channels showed class 5 students unable to recollect tables.

33.title: 'Stay single like me', says Nagaland minister on World Population Day; tweet viral
33.article_body: Nagaland's Higher Education and Tribal Affairs Minister Temjen Along's tweet on World Population Day has gone viral. "Let's be sensible towards the issues of population growth and inculcate informed choices on childbearing," said Along, adding, "Or #StaySingle like me and together we can contribute towards a sustainable future." Along's speech on 'benefits of small eyes' had earlier gone viral.

34.title: Goa Congress MLAs being offered ₹50 cr by BJP to join party: Siddaramaiah
34.article_body: Ex-Karnataka CM Siddaramaiah alleged that BJP is offering ₹50 crores to Goa Congress MLAs and said that by doing this they (BJP) are not believing in democracy. "Not only in Goa, everywhere they do Operation Kamala. They will offer money, they will purchase MLAs," the Congress leader said. It's not possible for BJP to do this in Karnataka, he added.

35.title: Sri Lankan PM holds Cabinet meeting as PMO confirms Prez's resignation
35.article_body: Sri Lankan PM Ranil Wickremesinghe held a Cabinet meeting with all the ministers at the Prime Minister's Office (PMO) on Monday, the PM's media unit said. It added that all ministers maintained that they'll hand over their responsibilities "as soon as there's an agreement to form an All-Party Government". This comes as Sri Lanka's PMO officially confirmed the President's resignation.

36.title: 94-yr-old Bhagwani wins 1 gold, 2 bronze medals at 2022 World Masters Athletics C'ships
36.article_body: Bhagwani Devi Dagar, a 94-year-old woman from India, bagged a gold medal and two bronze medals at the World Masters Athletics Championships 2022. The Indian athlete won the gold medal in the 100-metre sprint event, which she ran in 24.74 seconds. She bagged one of her two bronze medals in shot put.

37.title: Modi is weakest PM; 'undeclared emergency' under his rule: CM KCR
37.article_body: Telangana CM K Chandrashekar Rao said that PM Narendra Modi is the weakest and most inefficient Indian PM of all time. CM Rao also said that there is an "undeclared Emergency" in India under PM Modi's rule. "During the Congress rule, there was brain-drain. Now, with BJP's policies, there is a capital drain, resulting in depleting forex reserves," he added.

38.title: Police seizes truck carrying gutkha worth ₹91 lakh in Pune
38.article_body: The Pimpri-Chinchwad Police intercepted a truck carrying banned gutkha worth ₹91 lakh at the Pune-Nashik highway on Sunday. The officials of the Chakan Police Station arrested the truck driver, Ganesh Bhadale (32), by laying a trap in the Waki Khurd area. Notably, since 2020, the Pimpri Chinchwad Police have seized gutkha and paan masala products worth over ₹10 crores.

39.title: UP man on Interpol's 'red notice' arrested at Delhi's IGI airport
39.article_body: Noida Police's Special Task Force arrested a UP man, who had been missing for eight years and had been on Interpol's 'red notice' from Delhi's Indira Gandhi International Airport on Sunday, officials said. The accused had killed a man and robbed his motorcycle in 2013. According to police, he got a fake passport in 2016 and escaped to Saudi Arabia.

40.title: Kohli shouldn't be dropped, he can single-handedly win you WC: Sarandeep
40.article_body: Ex-Team India selector Sarandeep Singh has said Virat Kohli shouldn't be dropped from India's T20I squad ahead of the 2022 T20 World Cup. "Everybody knows his capabilities and his potential. He can single-handedly win you World Cup," he stated. Sarandeep also questioned the rest being given to Kohli, stating that playing is the only way to get back to form.

41.title: Quite a few brilliant shots: Tendulkar on Suryakumar's 117 in Nottingham
41.article_body: Praising India batter Suryakumar Yadav following his ton in the third T20I against England in Nottingham, Sachin Tendulkar said, "Amazing hundred." He tweeted, "There were quite a few brilliant shots but those scoop sixes over point were just spectacular." Suryakumar scored 117 runs off 55 deliveries. It was Suryakumar's maiden T20I century. England beat India by 17 runs.

42.title: 2 terrorists, including top JeM commander, killed in J&K's Awantipora
42.article_body: At least two terrorists belonging to terror group Jaish-e-Mohammad (JeM) were killed in an encounter in Jammu and Kashmir's Awantipora on Monday. One of the terrorists has been identified as top JeM commander Kaiser Koka while the identity of the other is being ascertained, police said. Incriminating materials, arms and ammunition including a US-made rifle among others have been recovered.

43.title: Ex-Punjab MLA Simarjeet Bains surrenders before court in rape case
43.article_body: Former Lok Insaaf Party (LIP) MLA Simarjeet Singh Bains on Monday surrendered before a court in Punjab's Ludhiana in connection with a rape case, Joint Commissioner Ravcharan Singh Brar has confirmed. Police took custody of Simarjeet, whose younger brother Karamjit Singh Bains and aide Sukhchain Singh are already in jail in the case.

44.title: I had tested for Dayaben's role, not sure I'm doing it: Aishwarya
44.article_body: Actress Aishwarya Sakhuja has stated that she had tested for the role of Dayaben for the television show 'Taarak Mehta Ka Ooltah Chashmah', adding that she doesn't think she is doing it. The makers of the show had confirmed that the character will be returning to the show but actress Disha Vakani will not be portraying her.

45.title: It won't be easy for Pakistan to beat India this time: Shoaib Akhtar
45.article_body: Former Pakistan pacer Shoaib Akhtar has said it won't be "easy" for the Babar Azam-led side to beat Team India in the T20 World Cup in Australia later this year. "India will come up with proper planning this time around," he stated. Pakistan had defeated India by 10 wickets in the 2021 T20 World Cup in UAE.

46.title: Biotech startup String Bio raises $20 mn in Series B funding round
46.article_body: Biotech startup String Bio raised $20 million in its Series B funding round from Woodside Energy, Ankur Capital, Dare Ventures, Redstart and Zenfold Ventures. The Bengaluru-based startup has also signed an agreement with Australia's Woodside Energy for producing sustainable protein ingredients from greenhouse gases. The company uses biotechnology to produce animal feed and food ingredients.

47.title: It was physically exhausting: Nora on directing song 'Dirty Little Secret'
47.article_body: Actress Nora Fatehi, who turned director and choreographer for her international single 'Dirty Little Secret', opened up about the challenges of being behind the camera. Nora said, "It requires...lot of pre-planning." "It was physically exhausting, especially the last day of the shoot. We shot for around 20 hours. [I had to make sure]...the dancers were in sync," she added.

48.title: Panneerselvam's supporters slap slippers at Palaniswami's photo in Chennai
48.article_body: Former Tamil Nadu CM O Panneerselvam’s supporters slapped slippers at Edappadi K Palaniswami’s photo as they protested AIADMK’s General Council meeting in Vanagaram, Chennai on Monday. Panneerselvam was expelled from all posts of AIADMK after Palaniswami took control of party as its interim General Secretary. Earlier today, supporters of both leaders clashed near party’s headquarters in Chennai.

49.title: 24 gamblers detained in Bengaluru, over ₹2.5 lakh cash seized
49.article_body: The Central Crime Branch (CCB) in Bengaluru detained 24 gamblers in the city and seized over ₹2.5 lakh in cash from their possession. The gambling games were organised in Vidyaranyapura and Halasuru Gate police station areas. Last week, the Crime Branch arrested three people for selling drugs and seized items worth ₹83 lakh from the accused.

50.title: Razorpay, Pine Labs among 1st firms to get RBI's payment aggregator, gateway licences
50.article_body: Online payment providers Razorpay and Pine Labs are among the first companies to receive in-principle approval from RBI for payment aggregator (PA) and payment gateway (PG) licences. The RBI has asked the companies to conduct an audit within the next six months for final approval. Companies like BharatPe, PhonePe and Amazon, among others, too applied for the licences.

51.title: Can't allow mindset of 1 person having 10 children: Giriraj Singh
51.article_body: Union Minister Giriraj Singh said that there is an urgent need for a stringent law on population control. "We have limited resources. Our population is expanding like the mouth of Sursa (mythical female demon)," Giriraj said on the occasion of World Population Day. He added, "The perverse mindset out of which one person sires 10 children can not be allowed."

52.title: BJP Mahila Morcha member dies by suicide in Kerala, blames BJP leader
52.article_body: A BJP Mahila Morcha member died by suicide after hanging herself in her house in Kerala's Palakkad and blamed a local BJP leader in her suicide note, police said. Her brother spoke to a TV channel saying that the leader used her, adding other women are in the same situation. An FIR has been filed and probe has been launched.

53.title: Decomposed body of 21-yr-old woman found inside sack in Gr Noida
53.article_body: A 21-year-old woman's decomposed body was found stuffed and tied inside a sack in a house in Greater Noida's Sector Gamma 1 on Saturday night. The deceased, Pooja Bharti, hailed from Bihar and was reportedly preparing for a government job exam. According to police, Bharti was sharing the flat with a man, who is absconding since her body was found.

54.title: Hemsworth's 'Thor: Love and Thunder' earns ₹64.80 cr in 4 days in India
54.article_body: Chris Hemsworth-starrer 'Thor: Love and Thunder' has earned ₹64.80 crore in India within four days of its release. Film trade analyst Taran Adarsh took to Twitter to share the box office figures of the Taika Waititi directorial, writing that it earned ₹18.20 crore on Thursday and collected ₹11.40 crore, ₹16.80 crore, ₹18.40 crore on Friday, Saturday and Sunday respectively.

55.title: Kerala Minister R Bindu donates gold bangle for kidney patient's treatment
55.article_body: Kerala Minister R Bindu has donated one of her gold bangles for the treatment of a kidney patient who has to undergo transplant. Bindu was attending a meeting in Irinjalakuda area of Thrissur district of a medical aid committee for kidney transplantation and removed one of her bangles to give it as first donation for the patient's treatment.

56.title: India's inflation likely held steady just above 7% in June: Poll
56.article_body: India's retail inflation likely held steady just above 7% in June, a Reuters poll found. The poll of 42 economists showed inflation, as measured by the consumer price index (CPI), was steady at an annual 7.03% in June, as compared to 7.04% in May. Forecasts for the data, due on July 12, ranged from 6.45% to 7.70%.

57.title: 14 students score 100 percentile in JEE Main session 1, Sneha Pareek only girl topper
57.article_body: Fourteen students have scored perfect 100 percentile in JEE Main 2022 session 1. Notably, Sneha Pareek from Assam is the only girl topper. The other toppers are Jasti Yashwanth VVS, Aniket Chattopadhyay, Dheeraj Kurukunda, Rupesh Biyani, Koyyana Suhas, Penikalapati Ravi Kishore, Polisetty Karthikeya, Kushagra Srivastava, Mrinal Garg, Sarthak Maheshwari, Navya, Boya Haren Sathvik and Saumitra Garg.

58.title: Zubair sent to 14-day judicial custody by UP court for allegedly sharing false news
58.article_body: Fact-checker Mohammed Zubair was remanded to 14-day judicial custody by a Lakhimpur Kheri court in UP on Monday, days after Supreme Court granted him five-day bail. Zubair has been remanded in a case that was filed last year. A local TV journalist had lodged a police complaint alleging that Zubair circulated false news to disturb communal harmony.

59.title: IMF made us dance to its tune but hasn't released $6 bn loan: Pak minister
59.article_body: Pakistan's Interior Minister Rana Sanaullah said that the IMF hasn't released the tranche of the $6 billion bailout package even though it made the country "dance to its tune". Sanaullah said that the country is currently going through a difficult situation in terms of its economy and the government had accepted the IMF terms which they "weren't in favour of".

60.title: Transgender, 9 others booked for attacking female YouTuber in Pune
60.article_body: A transgender person has been booked along with at least nine other people in Pune for alleged attempted assault on a woman who runs a YouTube channel, officials said on Sunday. The primary accused has been identified as Sagar Popat Shinde alias Shivlaxmi Zalte. The accused persons allegedly attacked the woman, accusing her of spreading false information about them.

61.title: Sri Lankan Prez orders 'smooth' distribution of LPG amid protests
61.article_body: Sri Lankan President Gotabaya Rajapaksa has ordered officials to ensure the "smooth" distribution of 3,700 metric tonnes of LPG received by the country, his office said on Sunday. This comes as the country is facing a shortage of fuel amid a worsening economic crisis. Rajapaksa's location is unknown since protesters entered his office and official residence.

62.title: I was molested by my cousins in India while growing up: Singer-actress Monica Dogra
62.article_body: In a recent interview where she talked about being pansexual, Indian-American singer-actress Monica Dogra revealed she was molested by her cousins in India while growing up. Dogra added she was also touched inappropriately by a family friend in her sleep. While talking about her sexuality, she said, "Growing up, I was ashamed of my gender for the most part."

63.title: Every minute Biden is late, he'll get 1 less minute with me: Uber ex-CEO in leaked 2016 text
63.article_body: Uber's ex-CEO Travis Kalanick's text to a colleague in 2016, after then-US Vice President Joe Biden was late to a meeting with him, has surfaced as part of the leaked documents obtained by The Guardian. "I've had my people let him know that every minute late he is, is one less minute he'll have with me," Kalanick's text message read.

64.title: Usman Khawaja mocks Kapil Dev's 'bench Kohli in T20Is' remark, says 'Australia agrees'
64.article_body: Australia batter Usman Khawaja mocked ex-India captain Kapil Dev's 'bench Virat Kohli in T20Is' remark.  "Averages 50 at almost 140 [strike rate]. Good call. Australia agrees," wrote Khawaja with a couple of 'tears of laughter' emojis. Khawaja was responding to ICC's post on Instagram wherein Kapil suggested that Kohli's reputation shouldn't decide his place in the side.

65.title: Pic of 500-million-year-old fossilised brain of 3-eyed predator released
65.article_body: The fossilised brain of a creature with three eyes, that lived 500 million years ago is being studied by scientists. Pictures of the remains of the brain and nerves of the marine predator called Stanleycaris have been released. "The details are so clear it's as if we're looking at an animal that died yesterday," said a researcher on the fossil.

66.title: Was left speechless by some of his shots: Reece Topley on Suryakumar
66.article_body: England pacer Reece Topley, who was named 'Player of the Match' for his performance in the third T20I against India, has said he was left speechless by some of Suryakumar Yadav's shots during his 117-run innings in the game. "[It] was an unbelievable knock from the Indian side," he added. Suryakumar slammed 14 fours and 6 sixes in his innings.

67.title: IIT graduates' startup Vegrow raises $25 mn in Series B round
67.article_body: Founded by IIT alumni, B2B marketplace Vegrow, has raised $25 million in its Series B funding round. The round was led by Prosus Ventures and saw participation from existing investors Matrix Partners India, Elevation Capital, Lightspeed Venture Partners and Ankur Capital. The startup helps bridge the demand and supply for fruits by bringing buyers and traders on a singular platform.

68.title: India is playing a big role for Sri Lanka: Jayasuriya amid economic crisis
68.article_body: Amid economic and political crisis in Sri Lanka, former cricketer Sanath Jayasuriya said that India is playing a big role for the country. "India, being very helpful from the start of crisis, has given aide. We are thankful," he added. India earlier said that it has extended this year itself "an unprecedented support of over $3.8 billion" to Sri Lanka.

69.title: Ignored cartilage tear for 1.5 yrs, I've stress fracture now: Vivek Agnihotri
69.article_body: 'The Kashmir Files' director, Vivek Agnihotri, has opened up about the cartilage tear in his knee. The filmmaker said he has finally started his knee therapy after suffering the injury last year. Sharing a picture of his bandaged knee, Vivek wrote on Twitter, "Finally, knee therapy begins. Fully ignored Meniscus (cartilage tear) for 1.5 yrs...Now I also have stress fracture."

70.title: 'Avengers: Endgame' directors to visit India for 'The Gray Man' premiere
70.article_body: Director duo Joe and Anthony Russo, aka Russo Brothers, will be in India for the premiere of their upcoming film 'The Gray Man'. The filmmakers, known for 'Avengers: Infinity War' and 'Avengers: Endgame', will be joining Dhanush for the premiere in Mumbai. In a video message, Joe and Anthony said, "We're so excited to be coming to India...see you soon."

71.title: 2nd seeds Krejcikova and Siniakova win 2nd Wimbledon women's doubles title
71.article_body: Second seeds Barbora Krejcikova and Katerina Siniakova won their second Wimbledon doubles title after beating top seeds Elise Mertens and Shuai Zhang 6-2, 6-4 on Sunday. It was the Czech pair's fifth Grand Slam doubles title and second this year. They won the Australian Open in January. Krejcikova and Siniakova won their first Wimbledon in 2018.

72.title: Disqualify MLAs Michael Lobo, Digambar Kamat: Goa Congress to Speaker
72.article_body: The Goa Congress has petitioned the Speaker of the Assembly to disqualify its MLAs Digambar Kamat and Michael Lobo under the anti-defection law. Earlier on Sunday, it removed Lobo as the Leader of Opposition and claimed that a conspiracy was hatched by some of its own leaders with BJP. Reacting to the allegations, Kamat said he was "shocked and stunned".

73.title: Rain lashes several parts of Delhi after a hot & humid day
73.article_body: Parts of Delhi, including India Gate and ITO areas, received rainfall on Monday after a hot and humid day. The weather department has predicted thunderstorms accompanied by light to moderate intensity rain in the national capital. The Delhi Traffic Police took to Twitter to alert people and advised commuters to plan their journey accordingly.

74.title: Suryakumar will be part of India's playing XI for T20 WC: Piyush Chawla
74.article_body: Cricketer-commentator Piyush Chawla has said Suryakumar Yadav will definitely be part of India's squad for the T20 World Cup later this year. "100 per cent (he will be part of the squad). We all know what he can do in the middle-order...he just walks into the playing XI," stated Chawla. Suryakumar smashed his maiden T20I hundred against England on Sunday.

75.title: She's wonderful, I'm glad: Vaani Kapoor on comparison with Katrina Kaif
75.article_body: Reacting to her 'Shamshera' character being compared to Katrina Kaif's role in 'Thugs of Hindostan', actress Vaani Kapoor said that the former is wonderful. "I'm glad. If you're comparing me, please compare me to her beauty," she added. The actress further said that her part in 'Shamshera' is written in a different way and both films are very different.

76.title: Delhi govt to issue e-challans as 17 lakh vehicles lack PUC papers
76.article_body: Delhi government's transport department is set to notify vehicle owners who lack valid Pollution Under Control (PUC) certificates and begin issuing e-challans if certificates aren't obtained. Over 17 lakh vehicles lack PUC certificates in the national capital, officials said. A PUC certificate is a mandatory document that certifies that a vehicle's tailpipe emission is within permissible limits.

77.title: SC to hear plea alleging rise in attacks on Christian priests on July 15
77.article_body: The Supreme Court on Monday has adjourned for July 15 the hearing of a plea alleging the rise in the number of attacks on Christian institutions and priests across India. The bench headed by Justice DY Chandrachud, said, "What you [petitioner's counsel] are saying is unfortunate if it is happening." The petition was filed by the Archbishop of Bangalore Diocese.

78.title: Firefighters battle 250 wildfires in Portugal; 29 people injured
78.article_body: Portugal's government on Sunday implemented a "state of contingency" as thousands of firefighters battled nearly 250 wildfires in the country. At least 29 people, including firefighters and civilians, were provided medical assistance to treat minor injuries, the country's state media RTP reported. This comes amid a heat wave in the country with expected temperatures of up to 43 degrees Celsius.

79.title: 'Koffee with Karan' is cringe binge, guilty pleasure viewing: Karan
79.article_body: Filmmaker Karan Johar has called his celebrity talk show 'Koffee with Karan' "cringe binge" and "guilty pleasure viewing". "It's not meant to be breaking some cinematic barriers or intellectual barriers," the filmmaker added. He further said he is not taken seriously by intellectuals for his movies and for the show. "Everyone will watch it but they will criticise," Karan added.

80.title: We're with Congress: Michael Lobo after being removed as Leader of Oppn
80.article_body: A day after Goa Congress removed Michael Lobo as the Leader of Opposition (LoP), he said he told Goa AICC in-charge Dinesh Gundu Rao that he was not interested in continuing as LoP. "We're with the Congress party," he added. Earlier, Rao said that Lobo and ex-Goa CM Digambar Kamat hatched a "conspiracy" to ensure defection of Congress in Goa.

81.title: Bank employee killed after being mistaken for a thief in Bengaluru
81.article_body: Two security guards allegedly killed a 27-year-old bank employee on the suspicion that he was a thief trying to enter an apartment complex in Bengaluru. The two guards have been arrested. The victim was assaulted with an iron rod and had received injuries on his head. He was a resident of Odisha who had come to Bengaluru for training.

82.title: Fake IPL in Gujarat organised to cheat Russian punters; labourers acted as cricketers
82.article_body: Gujarat Police have busted a fake IPL racket in the state with the matches being staged for punters from Russia. The fake IPL matches were played among farm labourers acting as cricketers, while a Harsha Bhogle mimic commentated on the matches. The bets on the matches were placed from Russian cities of Tver, Voronezh and Moscow through a Telegram channel.

83.title: Following violence, DMK-led state govt seals AIADMK headquarters in Chennai
83.article_body: The AIADMK headquarters, 'MGR Maaligai', in Chennai was sealed by the DMK-led Tamil Nadu government following the violence and vandalism that took place between the supporters of senior party leaders, Edappadi Palaniswami and O Panneerselvam. The action was taken by the revenue and police officials after Panneerselvam walked out of the office saying that he would approach the court.

84.title: 34 MMTS train services cancelled amid heavy rains forecast for Hyd
84.article_body: South Central Railway (SCR) cancelled 34 MMTS train services due to heavy rains forecast for Hyderabad. All the MMTS trains on the routes Lingampalli-Hyderabad, Hyderabad-Lingampalli, Falaknuma-Lingampalli, Lingampalli-Falaknuma, Secunderabad-Lingampalli, and Lingampalli-Secunderabad have been cancelled, SCR said in a statement. The meteorological department sounded red alert warning till Tuesday.

85.title: Won't make excuses, judge us by what we did in last 5 yrs: Uber on 'Uber files' leak
85.article_body: Responding to the 'Uber files' leak regarding its alleged malpractices, Uber admitted to its "mistakes" but said it had transformed since 2017 after current CEO Dara Khosrowshahi took over. It said, "We've not and won't make excuses for past behaviour that is clearly not in line with our present values...Judge us by what we’ve done over the last five years."

86.title: SRK shows love and respect to his co-actor, it can ruin your habit: Taapsee
86.article_body: Actress Taapsee Pannu said that actor Shah Rukh Khan shows love and respect to his co-actors in his films. "[It] can truly ruin your habit," she added. "Most of my films end up being driven by my characters so I end up getting first credit. It happened long back that Shah Rukh sir started doing it," she further said.

87.title: We are getting oil at cheapest price; states must reduce prices: Jaishankar
87.article_body: External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar has said that states must take some measures to reduce the fuel prices in their respective states. "Oil we are getting is the cheapest available in the global market and this makes our government reduce the price," Jaishankar said. "World today seeing us as a nation which stepped forward during the pandemic," he added.

88.title: Mumbai woman arrested for defrauding investment bank of ₹3.5 crore
88.article_body: A Mumbai woman was arrested by the Powai Police for defrauding a multinational investment bank of ₹3.5 crore. The accused, Manpreet Shahani (40), was an employee with the firm for 16 years and deceived them by fraudulently buying gift vouchers in the company's name, police said. Notably, Shahani used to buy extra vouchers and would later get them encashed.

89.title: Over 1,000 applications pending for SC/ST/OBC scholarships with Delhi govt
89.article_body: Over 1,000 applications for SC/ST/ OBC scholarships are pending with the Delhi government's education department by the end of 2021-22. The government's Department for the Welfare of SC/ST/OBC has written a letter to the Director of Education (DoE) requesting that all "pending applications are verified immediately". Notably, 918 applications are pending for tuition fee reimbursement for 2021-22.

90.title: Uddhav writes to 15 Sena MLAs, thanks them for supporting: Report
90.article_body: Former Maharashtra Chief Minister Uddhav Thackeray reportedly wrote to 15 Shiv Sena MLAs, thanking them for their support during tough times, without surrendering to the pressure of threats or offers. He also called for a meeting with all Shiv Sena MPs at his residence 'Matoshree,' to take a decision on the next week's Presidential election, the report said.

91.title: Heavy rains uproot trees in 10 places across Pune, two cars damaged
91.article_body: As heavy rains lashed Pune, trees were uprooted in 10 places across the city on Sunday. Two cars were also damaged after trees fell on them amid the rains. Reports said that no casualties were reported in these incidents and the Pune fire brigade cleared the trees from roads. 13 trees were uprooted in the city on Friday.

92.title: Japan's ruling party wins Upper House polls after Abe's assassination
92.article_body: Japan's ruling party, Liberal Democratic Party (LDP), along with its coalition partner won a major victory in the Upper House elections on Sunday, days after the assassination of former PM Shinzo Abe. The LDP and its coalition partner now have a seat share of 146 out of the total 248. The country's PM Fumio Kishida welcomed the victory.

93.title: Sourav, Sehwag, Yuvraj all have been dropped when not in form: Venkatesh
93.article_body: Ex-India pacer Venkatesh Prasad has said all out-of-form players should be dropped irrespective of their reputation. "Sourav, Sehwag, Yuvraj, Zaheer, Bhajji (Harbhajan) all have been dropped when not in form...The yardsticks seem to have changed...there is rest for being out of form," he tweeted. Notably, Virat Kohli, Rohit Sharma and Jasprit Bumrah have been rested for West Indies ODIs.

94.title: Working on 'Shamshera' was a nightmare: Ranbir Kapoor
94.article_body: Actor Ranbir Kapoor said in an interview that working on 'Shamshera' was a nightmare. He added that it was the most physically draining film for him and his co-star Vaani Kapoor. "We were covered in dust. We were shooting in peak summer in Mumbai wearing woollen clothes. I also had a thick beard. So, it was really hard," said Ranbir.

95.title: Centre bound to honour commitment to Portugal, free Abu Salem after 25-year term: SC
95.article_body: The Supreme Court has said the Centre is bound to honour its commitment given to Portugal and release gangster Abu Salem on completion of his 25-year sentence in the 1993 Mumbai blasts case. The court however did not accept Salem's argument that his detention in Portugal should be considered while calculating 25 years of imprisonment. Salem was extradited in 2005.

96.title: 'House of Cards' actress Kate Mara expecting second child with Jamie Bell
96.article_body: Actress Kate Mara is expecting her second child with actor-husband Jamie Bell. The 'House of Cards' actress made the announcement in an Instagram post on Sunday. "There are three of us in this pic," Mara wrote alongside a photograph of herself and Bell holding hands. Mara and Bell are already parents to a daughter, who was born in 2019.

97.title: Rumours about me joining BJP spreading since 2017: Digambar Kamat
97.article_body: Former Goa CM Digambar Kamat said "rumours" about him joining BJP have been spreading since 2017. "If I wanted to go, I'd have gone. No one can stop me. But still, I led party from the front," he added. "I saw a video of the presser of Dinesh Gundu Rao (Goa AICC in-charge)...It has hurt me beyond words," he stated.

98.title: 23-year-old food delivery man killed in hit-and-run in Mohali
98.article_body: A 23-year-old food delivery man died on the Zirakpur-Panchkula flyover in Mohali’s Dhakoli after a speeding canter hit his motorcycle from behind on Saturday. The incident occurred when he was on his way to deliver food, an official said. The canter driver managed to escape. "We've the canter’s registration number and will be arresting the driver soon," the official added.

99.title: China warns Southeast Asian nations to not be used as 'chess pieces'
99.article_body: Chinese Foreign Minister Wang Yi while speaking at Association of Southeast Asian Nations' (ASEAN) Secretariat, said, "We should insulate this region from geopolitical calculations…from being used as chess pieces from major power rivalry and from coercion." This comes after Yi met with US State Secretary Antony Blinken last week. "The future of our region should be in our...hands," he added.

100.title: Was nervous for 'Adipurush', didn't know what I was going to do: Kriti
100.article_body: Actress Kriti Sanon said that she was nervous about taking up 'Adipurush'. "I didn't know what I was going to do and...how I was going to play part that holds so much importance in our religion and our history...With that weight, you also as an actor feel responsible because you're playing such an iconic character and a part," she added.

101.title: India must be ready to face upheaval due to AI: Rajnath Singh
101.article_body: Defence Minister Rajnath Singh said that India needs to work on artificial intelligence (AI) mechanism "extremely carefully" and it must be ready to face legal, ethical, political and economic upheaval that may follow due to this technology. "It should not be the case that a country or a group of countries establish their dominance on this technology," he added.

102.title: PM Modi unveils 6.5-metre-tall bronze National Emblem on top of new Parliament building
102.article_body: PM Narendra Modi on Monday unveiled the National Emblem cast on the roof of the New Parliament Building, the government said. The bronze cast weighs around 9,500 kg and stands 6.5 metres tall, according to officials. "Historic Moment...Deeply privileged to witness the moment," Union Minister Hardeep Singh Puri tweeted.

103.title: Won't take rest till we make Palaniswami CM of Tamil Nadu: AIADMK leader
103.article_body: Soon after Edappadi Palaniswami was elected as AIADMK’s interim General Secretary, ex-state minister and AIADMK leader Natham R Viswanathan said, "We won't take rest till we make E Palaniswami CM of Tamil Nadu." Furthermore, he said, "O Panneerselvam has a dual face. He doesn't want anyone to have a good life." "I'm happy that he is out now," he stated.

104.title: Indian origin humans to travel to space next year: Union Minister
104.article_body: Union Minister of State for Ministry of Science and Technology, Jitendra Singh has said that the preparations for Gaganyaan, India's maiden human space mission, are complete and humans of Indian origin will go to space next year. The trials of the mission scheduled to take place in 2023 will be conducted by the end of this year, the minister said.

105.title: Everyone knows the bowler will bowl short to Shreyas: Parthiv Patel
105.article_body: Ex-India wicketkeeper-batter Parthiv Patel has said Shreyas Iyer could've taken more responsibility during his 119-run partnership with Suryakumar Yadav in the third T20I against England. He further said that Shreyas needs to work on his shot selection. "Everyone knows that bowler will bowl short to Shreyas...He has to decide whether to attack it or survive by taking singles," explained Parthiv.

106.title: LuLu's biggest mall with 11-storey parking, 15 eateries launched in Lucknow
106.article_body: The biggest mall of LuLu Group International has been inaugurated in Lucknow. The mall has an 11-storey parking facility for over 3,000 vehicles. It also has 15 fine-dine restaurants and cafes and a mega food court with 25 brand outlets. The food court has a seating capacity for 1,600 people. The mall also has a dedicated wedding shopping arena.

107.title: Parts of Hyderabad to face water supply disruption on July 13
107.article_body: Parts of Hyderabad will face water supply disruption for 24 hours from 6 am on July 13 due to construction works for a flyover at Al-Jubail Colony, Falaknuma. The areas that will be hit by water supply disruption include - Kishanbagh, Al-Jubail Colony, Santosh Nagar, Vinaynagar, Saidabad, Chanchalguda, Asmangadh, Yakutpura, Madannapet, Mahbub Mansion, Nallakunta, Aliabad and Balapur.

108.title: India projected to surpass China as the world's most populous country next year: UN report
108.article_body: India is projected to surpass China as the world's most populous country next year, according to a report by the UN which said that the world population is forecast to reach 8 billion by mid-November 2022. The latest projections by the UN suggest that the world's population could grow to around 8.5 billion in 2030 and 9.7 billion in 2050.

109.title: Bharti Airtel shares fall 5% as Adani Group enters 5G spectrum auction
109.article_body: Bharti Airtel shares declined nearly 5% during intraday trade on Monday. On Friday, Adani Group confirmed its participation in India's first 5G spectrum auction that is going to be held on July 26. While Adani Group clarified that its intention is not to be in the consumer mobility space, it'll face Reliance Jio, Airtel and Vodafone India during the auction.

110.title: Can't thank my stars enough for getting Nambi Narayanan's biopic: Mishaa
110.article_body: 'Rocketry: The Nambi Effect' actress Mishaa Ghoshal took to Instagram to share pictures with Nambi Narayanan and wrote, "Can't thank my stars enough for having this...chance to act in your biopic." Mishaa, who portrayed Nambi's daughter Geetha, added the role will always remain close to her heart. She also thanked Madhavan for "choosing [her] to be...part of this beautiful biopic".

111.title: IndiGo clarifies what is 'Cute charge' after passengers share air tickets
111.article_body: Some passengers took to Twitter and shared pictures of the price breakup of their air tickets, showing that IndiGo had levied a 'Cute charge'. Responding to one of the tweets, IndiGo said, "Please know that the CUTE charges are levied at select airports for the usage of Common User Terminal Equipment (CUTE) services...We'd love to serve you on board!"

112.title: John Abraham starts shooting for next action thriller 'Tehran'
112.article_body: Actor John Abraham has started shooting for 'Tehran', an action thriller film directed by Arun Gopalan. Taking to Instagram, he shared a motion poster, revealing his look from the upcoming project. "Time for some ACTION! #Tehran shoot begins," he wrote. Written by Ritesh Shah and Ashish P Verma, it will be produced by Dinesh Vijan, Shobhna Yadav and Sandeep Leyzell.

113.title: MVA allies should contest 2024 state Assembly polls together: Sharad Pawar
113.article_body: NCP chief Sharad Pawar on Sunday said it's his personal wish that the three MVA allies, NCP, Shiv Sena and Congress, should fight the 2024 Maharashtra Assembly elections together. "This is my personal opinion. I'll first have to discuss the issue with my party leaders and talks can then be held with the alliance partners," he added.

114.title: Biden says he's considering abortion-related public health emergency
114.article_body: US President Joe Biden on Sunday told reporters that it is "critically important" for people to continue to protest over Supreme Court's ruling on abortion. Moreover, on being questioned about declaring an abortion-related public health emergency, he said that he has asked his administration to consider whether he has the authority to do it and what its impacts would be.

115.title: Defer disqualification pleas against Uddhav, Shinde camps: SC to Maha Speaker
115.article_body: The Supreme Court has asked Maharashtra Speaker Rahul Narwekar to defer disqualification petitions pending against both the Eknath Shinde faction and the Uddhav Thackeray camp. "Please inform the Assembly Speaker not to take up the disqualification petitions until this court hears the matter. Matters won't be listed tomorrow but inform the Speaker," Chief Justice of India, NV Ramana, said.

116.title: Mallya didn't show any remorse, adequate punishment must: SC in contempt case
116.article_body: The Supreme Court on Monday while sentencing fugitive businessman Vijay Mallya to four months in jail for a 2017 contempt of court case, said that the latter didn’t show any remorse and didn't appear before it during the sentencing. The court added, "Adequate punishment is a must to uphold the majesty of the law.” The court also fined him ₹2,000.

117.title: O Panneerselvam expelled from all AIADMK posts as Palaniswami takes charge
117.article_body: Former Tamil Nadu Chief Minister O Panneerselvam was on Monday expelled from all posts of the AIADMK after Edappadi K Palaniswami took control of the party as its interim General Secretary. Senior leaders and OPS supporters- JCD Prabhakar, R Vaithilingam and PH Manoj Pandian were also expelled from the AIADMK.

118.title: I'm not vaccinated and I don’t plan to get vaccinated: Djokovic on US Open
118.article_body: Novak Djokovic, who won his seventh Wimbledon title on Sunday, has said he's not sure about his future events due to his unvaccinated status against COVID-19. He stated, "I'm not vaccinated and I'm not planning to get vaccinated." Djokovic is likely to miss the US Open as the country does not allow unvaccinated travellers to enter its borders.

119.title: You look better than you did while working on it: Dalip to Kajol on 'Gupt'
119.article_body: As 'Gupt' clocked 25 years, actor Dalip Tahil told actress Kajol she looks better now than she did while she was working on the movie. Kajol also recalled how she took up the movie. "When Rajiv narrated script to me, I read it and said, 'I'll do it'...He was like, 'You'll really do it? I can't believe it'," she added.

120.title: BJP spokesperson spoke nonsense & our delegates apologised in other countries: KCR
120.article_body: Telangana Chief Minister K Chandrashekar Rao on Sunday said that one Bharatiya Janata Party's (BJP) spokesperson spoke "nonsense" and our delegates and ambassadors apologised in other countries. "Why should the country apologise when BJP has done something wrong?" he asked. Earlier, BJP suspended Nupur Sharma following her remarks on Prophet Muhammad.

121.title: Thappad se dar nahi lagta…Biwi ke surprise se lagta hai: Gaurav Taneja over arrest
121.article_body: YouTuber Gaurav Taneja has tweeted, "Thappad se darr nahi lagta sahab...Biwi ki surprise planning se lagta hai..#birthday". Taneja was arrested on Saturday after thousands of people gathered at a metro station in Noida to celebrate his birthday. His wife Ritu Rathee Taneja wanted to give him a surprise by hosting his birthday in a four-coach Metro, according to the couple.

122.title: YouTuber Gaurav Taneja shares memes over his arrest on birthday
122.article_body: YouTuber Gaurav Taneja (Flying Beast) has shared several memes on his arrest over birthday celebration in Noida metro. He also shared a meme trolling his wife Ritu Rathee for organising a surprise party. He was arrested by the Noida police on Saturday after thousands of people turned up at his 'surprise birthday party' at a Noida metro station.

123.title: Return $40 mn sent to family with 8% interest in 4 weeks: SC to Mallya in 2017 case
123.article_body: The Supreme Court on Monday sentenced fugitive businessman Vijay Mallya to four months in jail for a 2017 contempt of court case. Mallya was convicted of contempt in 2017 for transferring $40 million to his children in violation of court orders. The top court has now asked Mallya to return $40 million within four weeks with 8% interest.

124.title: Man cheats Mumbai's customs official of ₹13.50 lakhs by selling fake gold coins
124.article_body: A senior customs official lodged a complaint with police alleging that he was cheated of ₹13.50 lakhs by a man who sold him fake British-era gold coins. As per the victim, he got the coins checked with a jeweller who authenticated them as real. However, during the time of handing over the coins, the seller changed them with fake ones.

125.title: UK Foreign Minister Liz Truss announces bid to run for PM
125.article_body: UK Foreign Minister Liz Truss has announced her bid to succeed Boris Johnson as the next Prime Minister. She wrote in The Telegraph, "Under my leadership, I would start cutting taxes from day one to take immediate action to help people deal with...cost of living." Truss joined 10 other candidates who have declared their bid to run for the post.

126.title: Feels surreal when people call me Avantika: Tamannaah on 7 yrs of Baahubali
126.article_body: Tamannaah Bhatia took to Twitter to share a post marking seven years of her movie 'Baahubali: The Beginning'. The actress, who played Avantika in the film, wrote, "Even after 7 years...when people call me Avantika, it feels surreal." Tamannaah added she feels proud to be a part of a film franchise that has made an impact all over the world.

127.title: Djokovic is a bit of God, I'm not gonna lie: Kyrgios after Wimbledon final
127.article_body: After suffering defeat in the Wimbledon final against Novak Djokovic, Australian tennis player Nick Kyrgios said the seven-time Wimbledon champion is a "bit of God". He added, "I played a Slam final against one of the greatest of all time...It was a hell of an occasion." Djokovic won the match 4-6, 6-3, 6-4, 7-6(7-3) in three hours.

128.title: Rupee hits new record low of 79.38 against US dollar
128.article_body: The Indian rupee touched an all-time low of 79.38 against the US dollar during Monday's early trade. On Friday, the Indian rupee had closed at a record low of 79.26 against the US dollar. On Monday, domestic markets opened lower with BSE Sensex declining 372.15 points to 54,109.69, and the Nifty was down nearly 0.6% at 16,126.45.

129.title: It was horrifying, river water turned black: Amarnath cloudburst survivor
129.article_body: Nitin Sharma from Rajasthan, who was in Amarnath on the day of the cloudburst, said "it was horrifying". "When we were just one km away from the Baltal base camp, we saw that the water of the river got black and the water level started rising. This seemed...strange," he said, adding he has never seen "such a dark cloud".

130.title: Vijay Mallya sentenced to 4 months in jail, fined ₹2,000 in 2017 contempt case by SC
130.article_body: The Supreme Court has sentenced fugitive businessman Vijay Mallya to four months in jail and imposed a fine of ₹2,000 on him after he was found guilty of contempt of court in 2017 for withholding information from the court. The court also reportedly ordered Mallya's family members to return $40 million transferred to them in violation of the court orders.

131.title: Wife, ex-wife, daughter arrested for hiring shooter to kill DTC employee
131.article_body: Days after a Delhi Transport Corporation (DTC) bus driver was shot dead, the Delhi Police arrested his wife, his ex-wife and his 21-year-old daughter for allegedly planning the murder conspiracy. According to the police, they hired a contract killer for ₹15 lakh to execute the murder. Two others, including the contract killer, are absconding, the police said.

132.title: Electricity bills in Delhi for June jumps by 2-6%
132.article_body: The electricity bills received this month by Delhi residents have reflected a hike of 2-6%. The hike, which came into effect on June 10, has happened due to the imposition of an additional power purchase adjustment cost surcharge. Notably, the surcharge will be in effect till August 31, 2022, or till further orders, the Delhi Electricity Regulatory Commission said.

133.title: 3 women destroy US restaurant, attack workers over $1.75 for extra sauce; video surfaces
133.article_body: Three women have been arrested and charged with robbery and criminal mischief after they were filmed destroying a New York City restaurant and attacking workers over $1.75 for extra sauce. One woman was seen hurling a can while other two climbed over the counter and launched bottles of sauce. At one point, one of them even danced on the counter.

134.title: Musk shares laughing meme as Twitter plans legal action against him for ending deal
134.article_body: Tesla CEO Elon Musk shared a meme on Monday after he terminated the $44 billion Twitter deal on Friday. The meme featured Musk laughing at statements such as 'They said I couldn't buy Twitter' and 'They want to force me to buy Twitter in court'. Twitter plans to take legal action against Musk to force him to accept the deal.

135.title: Palaniswami, Panneerselvam supporters clash in TN; some injured
135.article_body:
Some people were injured after supporters of AIADMK leaders Edappadi K Palaniswami and 
O Panneerselvam clashed near the party's headquarters in Tamil Nadu's Chennai amid its General Council meeting. This comes after the Madras High Court allowed AIADMK to hold the meeting today after rejecting Panneerselvam's plea to stall it. A video of the clash shows people throwing chairs.

136.title: India categorically denies reports of sending troops to Sri Lanka
136.article_body: The Indian High Commission in Sri Lanka has categorically denied "speculative" reports of India sending its troops to Sri Lanka. This comes as protesters in Sri Lanka entered the President's official home and set the Prime Minister's private residence on fire amid the economic crisis. "These reports...are also not in keeping with the position of Government of India," it added.

137.title: Some people think they are born to rule: Shinde on Uddhav
137.article_body: Maharashtra CM Eknath Shinde said that he was not born with a "golden spoon" and is a common man. Referring to Uddhav Thackeray, he said, "Some people think they are born to rule...They should have felt proud that a common man has assumed the chair." "They are filing petitions...But even the court knows...We haven't done anything illegal," Shinde added.

138.title: Sri Lankan Oppn meets to form new govt as Prez, PM offer to resign
138.article_body: Sri Lankan Opposition parties met on Sunday to agree on the formation of a new government as President Gotabaya Rajapaksa and PM Ranil Wickremesinghe offered to resign amid the country's economic crisis. This comes as protesters entered the President's official home and set the PM's private residence on fire. Four Sri Lankan Cabinet ministers have also resigned.

139.title: Video shows stadium developing cracks as football fans jump in Argentina
139.article_body: A video of cracks developing in La Bombonera stadium in Argentina as fans jumped during a Copa Libertadores match between Boca Juniors and Brazilian side Corinthians recently is being widely shared online. The cracks in one of the upper tier stands could be seen moving under the weight of the fans. 'A catastrophe waiting to happen,' a person tweeted.

140.title: Gulzar-Sanjeev Kumar pairing was like Martin Scorsese-Robert De Niro: Anil
140.article_body: Anil Kapoor has said actor Sanjeev Kumar's creative partnership with veteran filmmaker-lyricist Gulzar was equivalent to Martin Scorsese and Robert De Niro's pairing. Sanjeev and Gulzar collaborated on several films including 'Mausam', 'Aandhi', 'Angoor', 'Koshish' and 'Parichay'. Anil was speaking at an event celebrating the 84th birth anniversary of Sanjeev.

141.title: Need to find a way to play players in form in T20Is: Virender Sehwag
141.article_body: Reacting to India's defeat in the third T20I against England, ex-India opener Virender Sehwag said India have players who can get going from the start, but unfortunately some of them are sitting out. He added, "Need to find a way to play the best available players in current form in T20 cricket." England won the third T20I by 17 runs.

142.title: Palaniswami elected as AIADMK's interim General Secretary, post elections in 4 months
142.article_body: During a meeting held on Monday, Edappadi Palaniswami was elected as AIADMK's interim General Secretary. AIADMK General Council has adopted resolutions for reviving the general secretary post. It has also adopted resolutions to ensure electing a person for the post by the primary members of the party. The election will be held 4 months from now, news agency ANI reported.

143.title: Lobo, Kamat hatched conspiracy for defection in Cong: Goa AICC in-charge
143.article_body: Goa AICC in-charge Dinesh Gundu Rao said Michael Lobo, who was removed as LoP and ex-CM Digambar Kamat were hatching a "conspiracy" by "hobnobbing" with BJP to ensure defection in Congress in Goa. "Kamat did it to safeguard his own skin as so many cases are against him, Lobo did it for the sake of power and position," Rao added.

144.title: Video of 27 people coming out of single auto-rickshaw in UP goes viral
144.article_body: A video of an auto-rickshaw driver carrying 26 passengers, including elderly and children, in Uttar Pradesh is going viral on social media. The video showed police stopping the vehicle before asking all the passengers to deboard the three-wheeler and counting them. The auto, which was first spotted in Fatehpur, has been seized, according to reports.

145.title: Uber used 'kill switch' 13 times in 2014-16 in India & other nations, show leaked mails
145.article_body: The leaked emails have revealed that Uber deployed 'kill switch' 13 times between 2014-2016 in different nations globally. The 'kill switch' turned off systems in the event of serious regulatory action, like a tax raid. It was used in India, Amsterdam, and Paris, among others. In six cases it was used while raids were in progress.

146.title: I want to be attention in room & want the focus on me; I seek that: Karan
146.article_body: Filmmaker Karan Johar said that there are two parts of his personality. He spoke about being shy and an introvert in his childhood but added that he also wants to be the attention in the room. "I want the focus on me, I seek that as well. I don't run away from the fact that this is business," he added.

147.title: Madras HC allows AIADMK meeting for today; rejects Panneerselvam's plea
147.article_body: The Madras High Court has given a nod to AIADMK's general council meeting to be held today. The High Court also rejected O Panneerselvam's plea to stall the meeting. The meeting proposes to revive interim general secretary post and abolish coordinator as well as joint coordinator posts. The verdict was delivered on Monday morning.

148.title: 52 policewomen caught 100 criminals in last 1 year: Delhi Police
148.article_body: A year after the Tejaswini scheme was launched by Delhi's northwest district police, 52 female police personnel have caught 100 criminals including molesters, bootleggers and robbers. The scheme aimed at curbing crime against women and children, and also, empowering the females of the district, DCP (northwest) Usha Rangani said. Notably, the 52 Tejaswinis also counsel vulnerable girls, Usha added.

149.title: India reports 16,678 COVID-19 cases in 24 hours, active cases jump to 1,30,713
149.article_body: India has reported 16,678 COVID-19 cases, 14,629 recoveries and 26 deaths in the last 24 hours, according to the Ministry of Health and Family Welfare. This comes a day after the country saw 18,257 cases and 42 deaths. Notably, India's active COVID-19 cases jumped to 1,30,713, while the death toll reached 5,25,454.

150.title: My son is learning acting, he will be a huge superstar: Vindu Dara Singh
150.article_body: Actor Vindu Dara Singh has said his son Fateh Randhawa will be a "huge superstar". "Just wait for him this year, and you'll come to know," he added. Vindu further said Fateh has been learning acting, dance and action for the past couple of years, adding, "If I had done so much hard work, I would have been a superstar."

151.title: Auto-rickshaw carrying 27 people stopped in UP; video shows police counting people
151.article_body: A video of an auto-rickshaw driver carrying 26 passengers, including elderly and children, in Uttar Pradesh is going viral on social media. The video showed police stopping the vehicle before asking all the passengers to deboard the three-wheeler and counting them. The auto, which was first spotted in Fatehpur, has been seized, according to reports.

152.title: Watching SRK's old movies nowadays, love him in negative roles: Shehnaaz
152.article_body: Actress Shehnaaz Gill said that she is watching actor Shah Rukh Khan's old movies nowadays and that she loves 'Darr' and 'Baazigar'. She also said that she loves watching Khan in negative roles. In a video shared on her YouTube channel, she also mentioned her favourite fruit and who she connects that fruit to.

153.title: It was a fantastic game, we had slightly above-par score: Buttler
153.article_body: Speaking at the post-match presentation ceremony after winning the third T20I against India, England captain Jos Buttler said, "Good fun to play, fantastic game. I thought we had a slightly above-par score." Buttler also praised Reece Topley, who registered figures of 3/22 in the match. England put up a total of 215/7 and won by 17 runs.

154.title: There’re several Eknath Shindes in TRS: Telangana BJP chief
154.article_body: Telangana BJP chief Bandi Sanjay Kumar said there are several "Eknath Shindes" in TRS. "You (KCR) are state’s CM who is saying, BJP doesn’t have any strategy," he added. "He fears that leaders like Eknath Shinde are growing in his own party…Anyone can become Eknath Shinde in his party, it might be his son KTR, daughter or nephew," Kumar stated.

155.title: Violence guarantees success: Ex-Uber CEO in leaked emails amid driver protests
155.article_body: Leaked emails have revealed that Uber's former CEO Travis Kalanick encouraged Uber drivers to stage counter-protests amid taxi strikes and riots in Paris in 2016. Warned about its risks, Kalanick reportedly said, "I think it’s worth it...Violence guarantees success." Later, Kalanick's spokesperson said, "He never suggested Uber should take advantage of violence at the expense of driver safety."

156.title: 95 accidents involving PMPML buses in 15 months, 22 deaths reported
156.article_body: At least 95 accidents involving Pune Mahanagar Parivahan Mahamandal Limited (PMPML) were reported in 15 months from April 2021 to June 2022, reports said. Data said that in these accidents, 22 people were reported to have lost their lives. "PMPML should take strict measures against drivers when they are found to be guilty," secretary of PMP Pravasi Manch said.

157.title: What are some of the key revelations made by the 1,24,000 leaked 'Uber files'?
157.article_body: A collection of 1,24,000 leaked documents, known as the 'Uber files' and obtained by The Guardian, reveal that Uber flouted laws, duped police and secretly lobbied governments as it sought global expansion. Uber used a blocking software, internally called the 'kill switch', to prevent local police from accessing its data. Further, it discreetly courted world leaders, billionaires and media barons.

158.title: Bengaluru Police seizes properties of 3 drug peddlers over narco cases
158.article_body: The properties of three habitual offenders involved in narcotics trade have been seized, the Bengaluru Police said on Sunday. "This (property) attachment is a new thing. It will be quite effective in the long run," Joint Commissioner Raman Gupta said. This comes a day after Bengaluru Police, for the very first time, attached assets of a drug peddler on Saturday.

159.title: Hyderabad Police issues advisory amid red alert warning in the city
159.article_body: The Hyderabad Police issued an advisory urging people to avoid non-essential travel after the meteorological department sounded red alert warning in the city until Tuesday. The police also asked people to watch the weather and rain forecasts before venturing out. "All educational institutions have been closed by the government for three days," the advisory issued on Sunday stated.

160.title: I've been watching Suryakumar for a while now, he's magnificent: Rohit
160.article_body: Team India captain Rohit Sharma said he's proud of the fight they gave in the third T20I against England on Sunday. "I thought it was a fantastic chase although we fell short," he stated. Rohit also praised Suryakumar Yadav for his 117-run innings, stating that the 31-year-old has grown from strength to strength since they got him into the squad.

161.title: There's no system to forecast cloudburst events worldwide: IMD scientist
161.article_body: Following the Amarnath cloudburst incident, IMD scientist RK Jenamani said that worldwide, there is no system to forecast cloudburst events. "The modelling system often cannot catch how quickly these systems develop and how intense they are," he added. "The accumulation of a lot of moisture in the mountain topography leads to such events," he stated.

162.title: Man complains train has been hijacked; railway police replies 'it's diverted, not hijacked'
162.article_body: A passenger on Sunday took to Twitter to complain that train number 12650 (Karnataka Sampark Kranti Express) has been "hijacked" and sought help from the authorities. Responding to the tweet, the Railway Police Force replied, "Sir, The train is not hijacked. Train is diverted. Don't get panic." The Twitter thread is being widely shared online.

163.title: JEE Main 2022 session 1 results declared
163.article_body: The results for the Joint Entrance Examination Main (JEE Main) Session 1 were declared by the National Testing Agency (NTA) on the morning of Monday. The results are available on the following websites - nta.ac.in, ntaresults.nic.in, and jeemain.nta.nic.in. The second session of JEE Main is scheduled to be held from 21 to 30 July.

164.title: Gujarat sees heavy rains, bridge washed away; evacuation arrangements made
164.article_body: A flood-like situation has emerged in Gujarat amid heavy rainfall the state is witnessing. Amid rainfall, the bridge connecting Panchol and Kumbhiya villages in Tapi district was washed away. Meanwhile, over 700 people were evacuated from two districts in South Gujarat. The state Disaster Management Minister said that arrangements are being made to shift people staying in low-lying areas.

165.title: NZ create world record for scoring most runs in the 50th over while chasing in an ODI
165.article_body: New Zealand set the world record for scoring most runs in the 50th over while chasing in an ODI. Requiring 20 runs to win from last over against Ireland in first ODI, New Zealand's Michael Bracewell slammed 24 runs in five balls. The previous record, in any ODI chase, was held jointly by England and Afghanistan, who scored 20 runs.

166.title: Don't know who these experts are and why they're called experts: Rohit on Kohli's critics
166.article_body: Team India captain Rohit Sharma, while defending Virat Kohli amid criticism over his bad form, said, "I don't know who these experts are and why they're called experts." He added, "They're seeing from outside, they don't know what's happening inside the team. We've a thought process, we make the team, we debate and discuss...and think a lot about it."

167.title: Twitter hires US law firm that invented 'poison pill' to sue Musk for ending deal: Report
167.article_body: Twitter has reportedly hired US law firm Wachtell, Lipton, Rosen & Katz as it prepares legal action against Tesla CEO Elon Musk, who terminated the $44 billion deal. The firm served Musk as a legal adviser in his plan to take Tesla private in 2018 and its founding partner, Martin Lipton, is credited with inventing the 'poison pill' strategy.

168.title: Rohit Sharma's 10-year-old tweet on Suryakumar goes viral after his T20I hundred
168.article_body: Rohit Sharma's 10-year-old tweet on Suryakumar Yadav has gone viral after the latter slammed his maiden T20I hundred against England on Sunday. The tweet dated December 10, 2011, reads, "Just got done with BCCI awards here in Chennai...some exciting cricketers coming up...Suryakumar Yadav from Mumbai to watch out for in future!" Suryakumar slammed 117 runs off 55 deliveries.

169.title: Work begins on 1,500 rainwater harvesting pits in Delhi, PWD floats tenders
169.article_body: On directions of Delhi Deputy Chief Minister Manish Sisodia, work has started on 1,500 rainwater harvesting pits across city. Officials said Public Works Department has floated tenders for its construction at Aurobindo Marg road and locations including South West, South East, North East and North West. An official said department is planning to construct 12 pits in South West Delhi.

170.title: Uber execs blamed Indian authorities after Delhi woman's rape by driver: Leaked files
170.article_body: Leaked internal communications between Uber executives in 2014 show they tried to put the blame for a Delhi woman's rape by an Uber driver, on Indian authorities. A former top official Mark MacGann talked about "weakness/flaw" in the "licensing scheme". Another senior official blamed Delhi Police for not identifying "some previous rape allegations" in the accused driver's 'character certificate'.

171.title: 'Don't talk to govt, be unresponsive,' Uber Asia Head told India team: Leaked email
171.article_body: Uber's then Asia Head Allen Penn told its Indian team in August 2014 to not "talk to government or folks close to the government" about any regulatory issues that Uber faces in India. "We'll generally stall, be unresponsive and often say no to what they want," Penn told the Indian team, as per leaked emails accessed by the Indian Express.

172.title: 'We're just f***ing illegal,' Uber executive said days after 2014 Delhi rape incident
172.article_body: Uber's former head of communications unit, Nairi Hourdajian, in an email to her colleague in 2014 said, "Remember that everything is not in your control, and that sometimes we have problems because, well, we're just f***ing illegal." The email, obtained by The Guardian, was sent six days after a 25-year-old woman passenger was raped by an Uber driver in Delhi.

173.title: 95 accidents involving PMPML buses in 15 months, 22 deaths reported
173.article_body: At least 95 accidents involving Pune Mahanagar Parivahan Mahamandal Limited (PMPML) were reported from April 2021 to June 2022, in which 22 people lost their lives, according to reports. Many accidents also happen because of poor maintenance of the buses, said Sanjay Shitole, secretary of PMP Pravasi Manch. The number of unrecorded accidents is huge, Shitole added.

174.title: Action sought against 2 Canada-based men for priest's murder in India
174.article_body: India has asked Canadian authorities to prioritise the investigation into two persons based in the country who have been named in a chargesheet by the NIA in connection with the 2021 killing of a priest in Punjab.
