Hardeep Nijjar and Arshdeep Singh were accused of conspiring to murder Kamaldeep Sharma. Nijjar is associated with the Sikhs for Justice separatist group.

175.title: German trade union calls for strike of Amazon workers on Prime Day
175.article_body: One of Germany's biggest trade unions, Verdi, has called on staff at seven Amazon warehouses across the country to go on strike during Sunday's night shift. The strike will coincide with Amazon's Prime Day sale, and has been organised as part of a longer battle regarding better pay and working conditions. Amazon doesn't expect this to impact its operations.

176.title: RBI imposes restrictions, withdrawal caps on 4 cooperative banks
176.article_body: The RBI has put withdrawal limits on four cooperative banks for six months due to their deteriorating financial positions. They also cannot grant or renew any loans, make investments or accept fresh deposits without RBI's approval. The banks include Delhi's Ramgarhia Co-operative Bank, Mumbai's Sahebrao Deshmukh Co-operative Bank and Sangli Sahakari Bank.

177.title: SIDBI to develop online platform for startups, investors
177.article_body: The Small Industries Development Bank of India (SIDBI) will develop an online platform to bring together startups and investors. The platform will be ready in two months, said Shruti Singh, Joint Secretary, Department for Promotion of Industry and Internal Trade (DPIIT). This portal, she added, would help startups as they would not look for Alternate Investment Funds (AIFs) outside.

178.title: Steel price has hit bottom: Industry amid 24% drop from April peak
178.article_body: Industry experts have said the price of steel has bottomed out and there is no headroom for it to go further down. Their remarks come as the price of benchmark hot-rolled coil (HRC) dropped to ₹59,800 a tonne on July 6. This is 24% less than its April 6 peak of ₹78,000 a tonne, as per data from SteelMint.

179.title: Govt exempts excise duty on ATF for Indian carriers flying overseas
179.article_body: The government has exempted excise duty on Aviation Turbine Fuel (ATF) for domestic airlines flying overseas. This has brought domestic carriers at par with international airlines. However, airlines will continue to pay 11% excise duty on ATF for flying domestically. Exemption from basic and special additional excise duty would be applicable retrospectively from July 1, Finance Ministry said.

180.title: Investors would ask me about work-life balance in 2009: Open COO Mabel
180.article_body: Neo-banking platform Open's COO, Mabel Chacko, said she has been lucky to receive investors who have been strong proponents of merit. Chacko, who co-founded the startup with her husband in 2017, said if it was 2009, investors would ask her about work-life balance or how she could start a company with her husband. Investors are now more gender-neutral, she added.

181.title: Uber used 'kill switch' to block info from Indian govt in 2014-15, leaked emails reveal
181.article_body: Uber used a unique blocking software called "kill switch" to block Indian authorities from accessing data sometime during 2014 and 2015, The Indian Express reported citing leaked emails. The software would cut off access to Uber's main systems, preventing authorities from gathering evidence. Notably, Uber was under probe after a driver sexually assaulted a woman passenger in Delhi in 2014.

182.title: Trade transactions with Sri Lanka may be settled outside ACU: RBI
182.article_body: All current account transactions including trade transactions with Sri Lanka may be settled in any permitted currency outside the Asian Clearing Union (ACU) mechanism until further notice, the RBI said. The ACU facilitates payments among member countries on a multilateral basis, thereby economising on the use of foreign exchange reserves and transfer costs. Currently, it has nine members.

183.title: Netflix's exit from Russia, inflation caused its slowdown: Co-CEO
183.article_body: Netflix Co-CEO Ted Sarandos has said there are multiple factors behind the streaming service's slowdown, including inflation's impact on household budgets, a decline in smart TV sales and its departure from Russia. "Every customer is asking the question of the value of a subscription in relation to its cost," he said. Notably, Netflix lost 2,00,000 subscribers in Q1 2022.

184.title: IIT grad wins ₹5 lakh for making device to keep agri produce fresh
184.article_body: IIT graduate Nikky Kumar Jha bagged the first prize at Schaeffler India's Social Innovator Fellowship Program for his startup Saptkrishi Scientific, which innovated a storage device that keeps agricultural produce like fruits and vegetables fresh for 30 days. Jha, who hails from Bihar, received ₹5 lakh as prize. He claimed the device consumes much less electricity than a refrigerator.

185.title: Policeman slaps boy for skateboarding in Delhi's Safdarjung Enclave
185.article_body: A police officer allegedly slapped a boy for skateboarding in Delhi's Safdarjung Enclave during an argument. Delhi Police received complaints from residents regarding boys skateboarding in the area and causing disturbances, and the argument broke out when the constable went to reprimand the boys. Police said that they have asked concerned officials to take suitable action against the constable.

186.title: AMCs added 51 lakh investor accounts in June quarter: AMFI data
186.article_body: Asset Management Companies added 51 lakh investor accounts in the June quarter, as per the data by the Association of Mutual Funds in India (AMFI). The total tally now stands at 13.46 crore. In comparison, 93 lakh accounts were opened in the March quarter, the data further showed. Notably, the industry crossed 10 crore folios in May 2021.

187.title: Aurobindo Pharma to reduce raw material imports from China
187.article_body: India's second-largest pharmaceuticals firm Aurobindo Pharma is planning to significantly reduce raw material imports from China to mitigate the risk of supply chains disruptions. It currently procures around 55% of its material from China. The company is also planning to shift the manufacturing of some of its pharmaceutical formulations from India to a newly built facility in China.

188.title: 4 Wimbledon titles in a row is no mean feat: Tendulkar on Djokovic
188.article_body: Praising Novak Djokovic following his fourth straight Wimbledon title, Sachin Tendulkar said it is no mean feat. "Djokovic's composure, focus...consistency has been the hallmark of his game over the years. Lovely to see Novak appreciating Nick Kyrgios and the staff at Wimbledon after this win," he tweeted. Overall, it was Djokovic's seventh Wimbledon title. He beat Kyrgios in the final.

189.title: Work quickly to find long-term solution: US to S Lanka amid crisis
189.article_body: The US on Sunday urged the political fraternity in Sri Lanka to "work quickly" to achieve long-term solutions amid ongoing protests due to the economic crisis. "Sri Lankan people have the right to peacefully raise their voices, and we call for the full investigation, arrest and prosecution of anyone involved in any protest-related incidents," a US State Department spokesperson said.

190.title: India's economic performance consistently improved in last 4 yrs: PHDCCI
190.article_body: India's economic performance consistently improved among the top 10 economies in the world over the last four years, PHD Chamber of Commerce and Industry (PHDCCI) said. It cited International Economic Resilience (IER) rankings, wherein India's position improved from 6th in 2019 to 2nd in 2022. India showed consistent improvement despite the COVID-19 crisis, PHDCCI President Pradeep Multani said.

191.title: Who wouldn't want to be in SRK film: Taapsee on the film Dunki
191.article_body: Speaking about working with actor Shah Rukh Khan in film 'Dunki', actress Taapsee Pannu said, "I am so happy and glad that it is this film I am doing with Rajkumar Hirani and Shah Rukh Khan." "Who wouldn't want to be in an SRK film? I was lucky...I got this one which has such a pivotal part," she said.

192.title: INS Vikrant successfully completes fourth phase of sea trials
192.article_body: India's indigenously developed aircraft carrier INS Vikrant successfully completed the fourth phase of sea trials on Sunday, Indian Navy informed. This phase included integrated trials of major equipment and systems, including key aviation equipment, the Navy said. The aircraft carrier's delivery is targeted at the end of July, followed by its induction in August, it added.

193.title: Car falls into rivulet on state highway in K'taka, 2 feared dead
193.article_body: A car on the Manjeshwar-Puttur-Subrahmanya state highway in Karnataka's Dakshina Kannada district was washed away after it accidentally fell into a rivulet. Police said that the incident came to light after watching CCTV footage. A search operation by the police, fire and emergency services recovered the car but the two passengers were missing.

194.title: Suryakumar breaks record for highest T20I score by an Indian outside India
194.article_body: Team India batter Suryakumar Yadav has broken the record for registering the highest-ever T20I score by an Indian outside India. Suryakumar smashed 117(55) against England in the third T20I at Trent Bridge in Nottingham to set the record. The previous record was set by KL Rahul on August 27, 2016, when he scored 110*(51) against West Indies in USA's Lauderhill.

195.title: Telangana BJP Chief to resume third phase of padayatra on August 2
195.article_body: Telangana's BJP Chief Bandi Sanjay Kumar will resume the third phase of his padayatra, 'Praja Sangrama Yatra', on August 2 for 20 days, BJP general secretary Tarun Chugh announced. He further added that Kumar will sit on a silent protest on Monday regarding issue of Podu lands. To address people's problems, bike rallies will also be organised from July 21.

196.title: England beat India, deny Rohit his world record 20th consecutive win as captain
196.article_body: England defeated India by 17 runs in the third T20I at Trent Bridge in Nottingham on Sunday, with India winning the series 2-1. With the win, England denied Rohit Sharma his world record 20th consecutive victory as captain in international cricket. Rohit would've equalled ex-Australia skipper Ricky Ponting's world record for most consecutive wins as captain had India won.

197.title: 2 Ukrainian army hangars storing US-made M777s destroyed: Russia
197.article_body: The Russian Defence Ministry on Sunday claimed that its forces have struck two Ukrainian military hangars that were storing US-made M777 howitzer guns. The ministry added that the hangars were situated near Kostantinovka in the Donetsk region. Ukraine has reportedly received around 100 M777s from the US and its allies, since the beginning of the war with Russia.

198.title: 7th heaven: US Open on Djokovic winning his 7th Wimbledon title
198.article_body: Following top seed Novak Djokovic's seventh Wimbledon title after defeating unseeded Nick Kyrgios in the final on Sunday, US Open took to Twitter and wrote, "Seventh heaven." It added, "Djokovic ties Pete Sampras with his seventh Wimbledon title." It's Djokovic's fourth consecutive title at the grass-court Grand Slam. Now only Roger Federer, with eight, has won more in men's singles.

199.title: Oath Keeper brought explosives to DC ahead of Capitol riot: US DOJ
199.article_body: The US Department of Justice (DOJ) has said in a court filing that a member of the Oath Keepers extremist group brought explosives to the Washington, DC area ahead of the January 6 Capitol riot. Prosecutors have alleged that Jeremy Brown, an Oath Keepers member from Florida, transported explosives to a Virginia hotel in his recreational vehicle on January 6.

200.title: SEBI may issue 'risk factor disclosures' on market trends: Report
200.article_body: The SEBI is reportedly planning to issue "risk factor disclosures" on market trends, including surges and collapses, to help investors make better decisions. Sources told PTI that the regulator has huge amounts of datasets and is in a position to analyse things that have gone good or bad for the investors. The disclosures might be made annually, half-yearly or quarterly.

201.title: How much prize money did Wimbledon winners and runners up get?
201.article_body: Serbia's Novak Djokovic and Kazakhstan's Elena Rybakina, who won the men's and women's singles titles, respectively, at the Wimbledon this year, won £2,000,000 (nearly ₹19 crore) each as prize money. Meanwhile, men's singles runner up Australia's Nick Kyrgios and women's singles runner up Tunisia's Ons Jabeur won £1,050,000 (nearly ₹10 crore) each.

202.title: Sara upset with Karan for confirming relationship with Kartik: Report
202.article_body: Actress Sara Ali Khan is upset with filmmaker Karan Johar for confirming her past relationship with actor Kartik Aaryan, Bollywood Life reported quoting a source. Kartik and Sara starred together in 2020 film 'Love Aaj Kal' and reportedly began dating during filming. Sara had also spoken about wanting to date Kartik during her appearance on 'Koffee With Karan' in 2018.

203.title: Ferrari's Leclerc wins 3rd F1 race of 2022 at Austrian GP after late issue
203.article_body: Ferrari's Charles Leclerc overcame a late throttle problem to win his third Formula One race of 2022 at Austrian Grand Prix on Sunday. Red Bull's Verstappen came second, while Mercedes' Lewis Hamilton completed the podium for the third race in a row. "I definitely needed that one...last five races have been incredibly difficult for myself and...the team," said Leclerc.

204.title: Suryakumar Yadav becomes 5th Indian to smash a hundred in men's T20I cricket history
204.article_body: Batter Suryakumar Yadav has become the fifth Indian to smash a hundred in men's T20I cricket history. The 31-year-old slammed his maiden T20I hundred off 48 deliveries against England in the third T20I in Nottingham. Suresh Raina, Rohit Sharma, KL Rahul and Deepak Hooda are the other four Indians to have slammed centuries in men's T20I cricket.

205.title: 3 people shoot dead Chhattisgarh couple after being denied alcohol
205.article_body: Three unidentified persons allegedly shot a couple to death in Chhattisgarh’s Jashpur district on Saturday night after they were allegedly denied alcohol, police said. According to the police, the unknown assailants reached the couple's residence and demanded traditional liquor made from the 'mahua' tree, which the couple refused to provide. The crime took place in Gaimunda Navapara village.

206.title: US-backed defence pact with Arab nations will threaten peace: Iran
206.article_body: Iran on Saturday warned that plans for a security alliance between the US, Israel and Arab nations to counter Iranian drones and missiles would jeopardise peace in the Middle East. US and Israel are reportedly seeking to lay the groundwork for an alliance with Arab nations, allowing the integration of air defence systems to counter Iranian missile and drone strikes.

207.title: YouTuber Gaurav shares permit to celebrate b'day in Noida metro after arrest, paid ₹38,000
207.article_body: After being released on bail, YouTuber Gaurav Taneja (Flying Beast), has shared a picture of a permission letter to celebrate his birthday inside a metro by Noida Metro Rail Corporation. The letter stated he paid nearly ₹38,000 to avail the facility from 2pm-3pm. He was arrested after thousands of people gathered at a Noida metro station to celebrate his birthday.

208.title: New COVID-19 Omicron subvariant found in China's Shanghai
208.article_body: A new subvariant of the COVID-19 Omicron virus has been found in China's Shanghai, a city official said on Sunday. Authorities identified an Omicron BA.5.2.1 case in the financial district of Pudong on July 8, Vice-Director of Shanghai's Health Commission Zhao Dandan said as per Reuters. It is linked to a case from overseas, Dandan has said.

209.title: Fan posts Kareena, Sujoy's pic; latter asks 'How do you get these'
209.article_body: Taking to Twitter, a fan posted a photo of actress Kareena Kapoor and director Sujoy Ghosh from 'The Devotion of Suspect X' sets. In the photo, Kareena wore a checked blue shirt as she stood next to Sujoy with her hand on his shoulder. Resharing the photo on his Twitter account, Sujoy wrote, "How do you get these photos?"

210.title: When will everyone stop asking: Shruti to fan asking about wedding
210.article_body: Actress Shruti Haasan recently conducted an interactive question and answer session on social media. A social media user asked her, "When will you marry dear?" to which the actress responded, "When will everyone stop asking dear." She said along with the answer, "It was a big eye roll, for your information." Shruti is dating visual artist Santanu Hazarika.

211.title: Nicki Minaj says she's not fat but pregnant, later says she's not pregnant
211.article_body: Rapper Nicki Minaj conducted a Live session on Instagram and addressed the rumours of her pregnancy during the session. She said, "I did mean to tweet this. I'm not fat, y'all, I'm pregnant." The rapper read the congratulatory messages and corrected herself, saying, "I'm sorry, I think I said it wrong. I meant to say I'm not pregnant, I'm fat."

212.title: It was like time slowed down: Ranveer on first meeting with Deepika
212.article_body: Actor Ranveer Singh spoke about his first meeting with his wife actress Deepika Padukone, saying it was at filmmaker Sanjay Leela Bhansali's house. "It was almost like time had slowed down. That was it for me," Ranveer said. He added that "sparks were flying almost instantaneously". The couple got married in 2018 in an intimate ceremony in Italy's Lake Como.

213.title: 4th Sri Lankan Cabinet minister resigns amid ongoing economic crisis
213.article_body: Amid Sri Lanka's ongoing economic crisis, Sri Lankan Minister of Investment Promotion, Dhammika Perera, resigned from his post on Sunday. Perera is the fourth Cabinet minister to step down after Harin Fernando, Manusha Nanayakkara and Bandula Gunawardana. This comes as Sri Lankan PM Ranil Wickremesinghe has also offered to resign, calling for the formation of an all-party government.

214.title: I was beaten by my parents after they found my love letter: Sai Pallavi
214.article_body: Actress Sai Pallavi revealed she was beaten by her parents after they found out about a love letter she had written to a boy when she was young. "I wrote a letter to a boy, it was in my childhood," she added. "Maybe when I was in my 7th standard. I was caught. My parents hit me hard," she said.

215.title: Djokovic beats Kyrgios to win 4th consecutive Wimbledon title, bags his 21st Grand Slam
215.article_body: World number three Novak Djokovic defeated world number 40 Nick Kyrgios in the men's singles final on Sunday to win his fourth consecutive Wimbledon title. Djokovic won the match with a scoreline of 4-6, 6-3, 6-4, 7-6(7-3) in three hours. With the victory, Djokovic has now taken his tally of Grand Slam titles to 21.

216.title: Happy to be defined by action, proud to be typecast: Vidyut Jammwal
216.article_body: Actor Vidyut Jammwal has stated that he is happy to be defined by the action genre, adding that he feels proud of being typecast. "It's not an easy place to be in when you get typecast for being the best at what you do," the actor added. Vidyut was last seen in 'Khuda Haafiz: Chapter 2 – Agni Pariksha'.

217.title: I would've played Hooda instead of Iyer in 3rd T20I vs England: RP Singh
217.article_body: RP Singh said batter Deepak Hooda should've played instead of Shreyas Iyer in third T20I against England as the former was in form. "But by playing Iyer, you're trying to get him back in his form which is beyond my understanding. If I was...captain, I would've played Hooda," he added. Hooda has scored 184 runs in his last three T20Is.

218.title: U'khand MLA, 59 others get stuck as ropeway halts for 25 minutes; rescued
218.article_body: At least 60 people, including BJP MLA Kishore Upadhyay, were stuck after a ropeway at Surkanda Devi Temple in Uttarakhand stopped for 20 to 25 minutes due to a technical fault. All the passengers have come out safely and the ropeway is now running smoothly, Tehri Garhwal SSP Navneet Bhullar said. No passenger is trapped in the trolley, he added.

219.title: Congress' allegation that govt is snatching tribal rights holds no ground: Arjun Munda
219.article_body: Union Minister Arjun Munda reacted to Congress' criticism of Forest (Conservation) Rules, 2022, saying the allegation that the Centre is trying to snatch tribal rights has no ground. Munda said Congress was trying to divert attention from the fact that NDA's presidential candidate is a tribal lady. "The Centre is totally committed for upliftment of the tribal communities," he added.

220.title: Centre shouldn't adopt a 'touch-me-not' attitude: Ex-EAM Khurshid
220.article_body: Ex-External Affairs Minister Salman Khurshid on Sunday advised Centre against adopting a "touch-me-not" attitude, days after Germany criticised Alt News co-founder Mohammed Zubair's arrest. "If we don't want an adverse opinion we must show the best side of us [to other countries]," Khurshid said. India had called Germany's comments "uninformed" after latter condemned journalists' 'persecution'.

221.title: Goa Congress removes Michael Lobo as Leader of Oppn for planning defections to BJP
221.article_body: Goa Congress has removed Michael Lobo as the Leader of Opposition with immediate effect, AICC Goa In-charge Dinesh Gundu Rao announced on Sunday. "A conspiracy was hatched by some of our own leaders with BJP to see that the Congress party in Goa is weakened and to engineer defections," Rao said. He said Lobo and Digambar Kamat led the conspiracy.

222.title: England record their highest-ever total against India in T20I cricket
222.article_body: England put up a total of 215/7 in their 20 overs against India in the third T20I in Nottingham today. This is England's highest total against India in T20I cricket. This is the second time England touched 200-run mark against India in T20Is. England's previous highest T20I total against India had come on September 19, 2007, when they registered 200/6.

223.title: IndiGo technicians go on mass leave over poor hike after mass leave by crew: Reports
223.article_body: IndiGo's aircraft maintenance technicians at major hubs like Delhi and Hyderabad took mass leave recently to protest poor increment, reports said on Sunday. This came days after the airline's flights were delayed across the country as the crew reportedly took mass sick leave to attend Air India's recruitment drive. IndiGo announced 8% hike for crew and pilots after the incident.

224.title: Rybakina's Wimbledon win not a surprise: Kazakhstan tennis chief
224.article_body: Kazakhstan Tennis Federation President Bulat Utemuratov said Elena Rybakina's Wimbledon win was not a surprise. "Elena had been improving on a consistent basis and heading towards this type of success for some time," he added. Rybakina, who was born in Moscow, switched allegiance to Kazakhstan four years ago to gain more financial support. It was 23-year-old's maiden Grand Slam title.

225.title: Hope that India will continue to help Sri Lanka: Sonia Gandhi
225.article_body: Congress expressed solidarity with Sri Lanka and its people amid the ongoing crisis in the country. In a message, Congress chief Sonia Gandhi said, "We hope that India will continue to assist the people and government of Sri Lanka as they deal with the difficulties of the current situation." Congress urged the international community to extend help to Sri Lanka.

226.title: Ranveer Singh buys luxury quadruplex for ₹119 crore in Mumbai's Bandra: Report
226.article_body: Actor Ranveer Singh has bought a quadruplex apartment in Mumbai's Bandra West for ₹118.94 crore, as per documents accessed by IndexTap. Ranveer has purchased the apartment through his company Oh Five Oh Media Works. The sea-facing property on Mumbai's Bandstand area is spread across the 16th, 17th, 18th and 19th floors, with a total carpet area of 11,266 sq ft.

227.title: Govt requests BCCI to organise India-World XI match to celebrate 75th I-Day: Reports
227.article_body: The Indian government has requested the BCCI to organise India-Rest of the World XI match to commemorate 75 years of Indian independence, reports said. The government has sent a proposal to BCCI to organise the match on August 22, reports added. If finalised, the match is likely to be held at the Arun Jaitley Stadium in Delhi.

228.title: My 'Stranger...' co-stars & I've group where they send 'RoNance' memes: Natalia
228.article_body: 'Stranger Things' actress Natalia Dyer revealed how fans aren't only shipping her with characters of Steve and Jonathan but also Maya Hawke's Robin. "There are things about both Steve and Jonathan that Nancy...likes. I noticed...there's a lot of 'RoNance' shipping as well. I love Nancy having a girlfriend," she said. "We send each other memes...regarding that ship," she added.

229.title: Crypto exchange CoinFLEX sues user over $84-mn debt in Hong Kong
229.article_body: Cryptocurrency exchange CoinFLEX has sued a customer in Hong Kong to recover an $84-million debt. The customer is reportedly cryptocurrency exchange Bitcoin.com's CEO Roger Ver. Earlier, CoinFLEX accused Ver of defaulting on a $47 million margin call. It has now said that the amount owned by the "individual" has increased after calculating the loss in liquidating his FLEX coin positions.

230.title: Punjab govt suspends 4 officers for constructing road during rains
230.article_body: The Punjab government has suspended four Public Works Department (PWD) officers for constructing a road amid heavy rains in the Hoshiarpur district. Sub-divisional engineer Tarsem Singh, along with three junior engineers, Vipan Kumar, Jasbir Singh and Parveen Kumar were suspended. The action was taken after a video went viral on social media, showing the workers constructing amid heavy rainfall.

231.title: 8-year-old boy seen sitting with 2-year-old brother's body on roadside in MP
231.article_body: An eight-year-old boy was seen sitting with his two-year-old brother's body on a roadside in Madhya Pradesh's Morena. The boy's father was looking for a vehicle to take them home after the hospital, where the two-year-old died during treatment, denied providing an ambulance citing unavailability, according to reports. They were reportedly provided an ambulance later after police intervention.

232.title: 3 killed, 4 injured as speeding truck hits van on Gujarat highway
232.article_body: Three persons died and four others sustained injuries in a collision between a speeding truck and a van on Pipali-Vataman Highway on the outskirts of Gujarat's Ahmedabad, police said. "The victims were traveling towards Kheda when the vehicle hit a truck in Dhandhuka area," an officer said. The condition of two of the injured passengers is said to be critical.

233.title: Arjun Bijlani and I are from same school, same football team: Ranbir
233.article_body: Actor Ranbir Kapoor recently appeared on television show 'Ravivaar with Star Parivaar' hosted by Arjun Bijlani. A video going viral on social media shows Ranbir saying that he is from the school as Arjun, adding they played in the same house's football team together. "I'm proud of where we are right now and hope to always stay grounded," Ranbir said.

234.title: WI need to improve playing spin, swing: Pooran ahead of Bangladesh ODIs
234.article_body: Ahead of the three-match ODI series between West Indies and Bangladesh, West Indies captain Nicholas Pooran said the team needs to have the right mindset and template for the format, adding they need to stick with it for a bit. Pooran further said that his team needs to improve the batting against spin and swing in the series.

235.title: PM Modi will meet same fate as Sri Lankan Prez Rajapaksa: TMC MLA
235.article_body: TMC MLA Idris Ali on Sunday said PM Modi will meet the same fate as Sri Lankan President Gotabaya Rajapaksa, who was forced to leave his official residence after anti-government protesters stormed into his official residence. According to reports, his remarks came after West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee wasn't invited to the inauguration of the Sealdah Metro station in Kolkata.

236.title: Foster religious harmony by respecting other faiths: Karnataka CM
236.article_body: Karnataka Chief Minister Basavaraj Bommai on Sunday spoke of the importance of fostering religious harmony by respecting other faiths and added that establishing religious harmony was important for promoting social equality. He made the remark while speaking at a programme organised in memory of retired engineer-in-chief Dr L Shivalingaiah. Shivalingaiah was an inspiration for the youth, he said.

237.title: Heard's insurer refuses to partly pay $8mn owed to Depp, says she 'wilfully defamed' him
237.article_body: Amber Heard's insurance firm, New York Marine and General Insurance Co, has refused to cover a portion of the $8.35 million that the actress owes to her ex-husband Johnny Depp as part of their defamation trial settlement. The company said it wasn't liable to cover the damages for Amber due to her 'wilful', 'malicious' act of defaming Depp.

238.title: I've been criticised for doing 'Koffee with Karan' for so many years: Karan
238.article_body: Karan Johar said that he has been trolled for doing 'Koffee With Karan'. "I've been criticised for doing the show for so many years. So many blames and things have been attributed to me," he added. "If I'm not taking my own show seriously, why are you taking it...It's just meant to be fun and games," he said.

239.title: SEBI mulls bringing mutual fund units under insider trading rules
239.article_body: The SEBI has proposed to bring transactions in mutual fund units under insider trading regulations. Insiders would include those who have access to unpublished price-sensitive information and their immediate relatives. In the past, a few key personnel of a mutual fund redeemed their holdings in the schemes while in possession of "sensitive information", the SEBI noted in its discussion paper.

240.title: RBI to release norms for digital lending this month: Report
240.article_body: The Reserve Bank of India (RBI) will release guidelines for 'Buy Now, Pay Later' (BNPL) service and digital lending later this month, Financial Express reported. A circular could be out as early as next week, the report added. Last month, RBI Governor Shaktikanta Das said the regulator would introduce a framework to curb malpractices in the digital lending segment.

241.title: New forest rules are reformative, we're committed to protect Adivasi rights: Govt
241.article_body: After Congress criticised the Forest (Conservation) Rules, 2022, Union Minister Bhupender Yadav said the rules are reformative with an objective to streamline the process of approvals under the Forest Rights Act. He also called Congress' allegations that the rules will disempower tribals "ill-informed" and said, "Government under Narendra Modi ji remains committed to protecting Adivasis' rights."

242.title: Tiger Shroff shares fan art showing him as Dragon Ball Z's Goku
242.article_body: Actor Tiger Shroff on Sunday took to Instagram Stories to share a fan's artwork which depicts him as the character Goku from Japanese anime television series 'Dragon Ball Z'. The fan shared the artwork on Instagram, writing, "@tigerjackieshroff As a Goku... In #ganapath Style. Kesa laga?" Tiger shared the art, along with the caption, "Love this thank [you] so much."

243.title: 76 dead in rain-related incidents in Maha so far this monsoon
243.article_body: Around 76 people have succumbed to rain-related incidents in Maharashtra during the ongoing monsoon season so far, a report by the state disaster management authorities said on Sunday. Of the total number of deceased, nine people died on Saturday, while as many as 125 animals have died since June 1 with rains lashing parts of the state.

244.title: Can't keep picking a player due to his past performances: Vaughan on Kohli
244.article_body: Speaking about Virat Kohli's place in the playing XI following his one off three balls against England in the second T20I, Michael Vaughan stated he's sure head coach Rahul Dravid and captain Rohit Sharma are not considering dropping him. "But you can't just keep picking a player because of what he has done in the past," he added.

245.title: 22-yr-old Mumbai man kills mother over property dispute, attempts suicide
245.article_body: A 22-year-old man from Mumbai's Mulund allegedly killed his mother on Saturday evening and later tried to end his own life. The man had allegedly left a suicide note, apologising to his father for his action, police said. Police added that the accused had committed the crime as he was depressed over some issues related to property.

246.title: 63 pilgrims from Maharashtra's Beed stranded in Amarnath rescued
246.article_body: As many as 63 pilgrims from Maharashtra's Beed who got stranded during the Amarnath pilgrimage were rescued and taken to Jammu, Srinagar and other places, an official has said. The pilgrims had got stranded near the Amarnath temple shrine. At least 16 people were killed and several others were reported missing in flash floods triggered by a cloudburst on Friday.

247.title: Drugs worth ₹10 cr seized from vehicle in Assam's Kamrup district
247.article_body: Police in Assam's Kamrup district seized drugs worth ₹10 crore from a mini-truck with an 'On Telecom Duty' sticker on Saturday night, a police official said. The seized drugs include five kgs of opium and 2,000 tablets, the official added. The occupants of the vehicle managed to escape and an operation is underway to locate them, he further informed.

248.title: Prithviraj apologises for 'Kaduva' dialogue on differently-abled children
248.article_body: Actor Prithviraj Sukumaran apologised for a dialogue in Malayalam film 'Kaduva' saying differently-abled children are born with their conditions due to the sins of their parents. He also shared director Shaji Kailas' statement in Malayalam which said that they only wanted to convey the villain's cruelty. Earlier, State Commissioner for Persons with Disabilities had issued a notice to the makers.

249.title: Govt unveils challenge to develop tech to reduce rotting of onions
249.article_body: The Centre has launched a Grand Challenge on Onion Storage for students, startups and corporates, asking them to develop technologies that reduce damage and rotting of onions. The challenge comes amid rising onion prices, and was launched by Department of Consumer Affairs on their Twitter handle. According to the Department, onion prices rose 2.3% in June from May.

250.title: 700 J&K youths recruited by terror groups in past 4.5 yrs: MHA data
250.article_body: As many as 700 youths from J&K have been recruited by terror groups in the past four-and-a-half years, according to Union Home Ministry statistics. As per the data, 82 foreign terrorists and 59 local terrorists were active in the union territory as on July 5, 2022. Security forces have eliminated 125 terrorists so far this year, the data further said.

251.title: Amarnath Yatra suspended from Jammu due to inclement weather conditions
251.article_body: The Amarnath Yatra has been suspended from Jammu due to inclement weather conditions, two days after a cloudburst near the shrine. No fresh batch was allowed to proceed from the city to the cave shrine. At least 16 people were killed and several went missing in the incident on July 8.

252.title: Pacer Richard Gleeson is a huge find for English cricket: Morgan
252.article_body: Calling Richard Gleeson's debut remarkable, ex-England captain Eoin Morgan said the 34-year-old pacer is a huge find for English cricket. "And one they can build towards the next World Cup and possibly the next 50-over World Cup next year," he added. Gleeson made his debut against India in second T20I in Birmingham on Saturday. He posted bowling figures of 4-1-15-3.

253.title: Grassroot Sainiks still with party despite betrayal: Aaditya
253.article_body: Shiv Sena leader Aaditya Thackeray on Sunday claimed the grassroot Shiv Sena workers were still with the organisation, despite "betrayal" by those whom the party trusted. "Those who are happy to leave should have the guts to face fresh elections. The doors of 'Matoshree' are open to all those who wish to return," he said.

254.title: PM Modi extends wishes to Bangladesh PM Sheikh Hasina on Eid
254.article_body: PM Narendra Modi conveyed his greetings to Bangladesh PM Sheikh Hasina on Eid-al Adha on Sunday. PM Modi recalled that the festival reminds us of the virtues of sacrifice and sharing. "Our ties help promote inclusive growth for all in both countries," the High Commission of India in Bangladesh quoted PM Modi as saying.

255.title: 3 people arrested for setting Sri Lankan PM's residence on fire
255.article_body: Sri Lankan authorities on Sunday arrested three people, including a 19-year-old person, for setting PM Ranil Wickremesinghe's private residence in Colombo on fire. While the extent of the damage isn't known, the house was replete with rare collection of books and Buddha statues, most of which were inherited, an official said. Wickremesinghe offered to resign as PM on July 9.

256.title: 7th accused in the Udaipur beheading arrested by the NIA
256.article_body: The seventh person accused of beheading Kanhaiya Lal in Udaipur has been arrested by the National Investigation Agency (NIA). The accused has been identified as 31-year-old Farhad Mohammad Sheikh, who is a resident of Udaipur. The NIA said that he is a close associate of Riyaz Attari, one of the main accused in the case.

257.title: Alia conducted mock interviews to prepare me for fatherhood questions: Ranbir
257.article_body: Actor Ranbir Kapoor revealed his wife, actress Alia Bhatt conducted mock interviews to prepare him for all fatherhood questions. "I knew I’d be asked...(fatherhood) questions a lot as I promote 'Shamshera'. So I rehearsed a lot with Alia too," he added. "She was asking me, 'Ranbir, you're going to be a father. How do you feel about it?'" he said.

258.title: Local gangster arrested for shooting dead 40-yr-old builder in Delhi
258.article_body: The Delhi Police Crime Branch arrested a man days after a 40-year-old builder was shot outside his office in Delhi's Paschim Vihar. The accused, who is a member of a local gang, claimed that he killed the deceased for refusing to sell weapons to him. The deceased was a professional shooter and imported weapons illegally, according to the police.

259.title: India announce their playing XI for 3rd T20I against England, make 4 changes
259.article_body: England captain Jos Buttler won the toss and elected to bat first against India in the third T20I at Trent Bridge in Nottingham. India have made four changes to their playing XI, with Ravi Bishnoi, Umran Malik, Avesh Khan and Shreyas Iyer replacing Yuzvendra Chahal, Jasprit Bumrah, Bhuvneshwar Kumar and Hardik Pandya. India lead the three-match series 2-0.

260.title: Mahindra may consider investing in an EV battery cell maker: CEO
260.article_body: Mahindra and Mahindra may consider investing in the EV battery-cell space if it needed to secure future supplies, CEO Anish Shah said. "Our intent is not to get into (manufacturing) batteries...There are people who do it...well," Shah stated. He added that Mahindra's deal with Volkswagen to source EV components will only meet its "short to medium term" battery needs.

261.title: Droupadi Murmu to visit Karnataka today to seek legislators' support
261.article_body: Droupadi Murmu, the National Democratic Alliance (NDA) candidate for the Presidential elections, will visit Karnataka on July 10, to seek support of the legislators in the state, as per BJP Vice President Nirmal Kumar Surana. Murmu, the former Jharkhand Governor, earlier visited Kolkata and Lucknow to campaign for support. She'll contest against opposition's presidential candidate Yashwant Sinha.

262.title: Govt shares pic of scenery forming the Indian flag, says 'nature flaunting Tricolour'
262.article_body: The Centre on Sunday shared a picture of a scenery forming the colours of the Indian National flag on Twitter under the 'Moments with Tiranga' campaign. "Nature flaunting the Tricolour," it wrote with the photograph provided by Sanjeev Kumar Singh. "Jhanda ooncha rahe hamara," a Twitter user reacted to the picture.

263.title: 2 Pune constables jump into stream, save man from being swept away
263.article_body: NCP MP Supriya Sule has shared a video showing two Pune Police constables jumping into a stream to save a man, who was being swept away by strong currents amid heavy rainfall in Maharashtra. "The courage shown by the two [policemen] is commendable! We are proud of the Maharashtra Police," she tweeted.

264.title: Over 10,000 fire incidents in Delhi till June 30 this year: DFS
264.article_body: Delhi witnessed over 10,350 fire incidents in the first six months of the year, claiming the lives of 60 people and injuring 395 others, the Delhi Fire Service (DFS) said. Director of DFS Atul Garg said that between January 1 and June 30, the department conducted 340 fire-fighting operations in commercial enterprises, 239 in industries, and 89 in JJ clusters.

265.title: Would tell Adani to go into sustainable, synthetic fuels: Safran CEO
265.article_body: Safran's CEO Olivier Andries told TOI that he would tell Adani Group Chairman Gautam Adani to "go into sustainable and synthetic fuels". Andries added that the French aerospace engine manufacturer has partnered with French energy major Total, which announced a strategic partnership with Adani Group. He further said they are urging Total to move up production capacity of sustainable fuel.

266.title: Women secretly given 'date rape drug' at bash hosted by Germany's top political party
266.article_body: Several women were secretly given a 'date rape drug' at an event hosted by Germany's top political party and attended by the country's Chancellor Olaf Scholz. As per Germany's Social Democratic Party, at least nine women reported feeling dizzy and unwell after the summer bash that was also attended by lawmakers. The cases may possibly increase, the party spokeswoman said.

267.title: Dharma shares video celebrating 7 years of 'Baahubali: The Beginning'
267.article_body: The official Instagram handle of Dharma Productions shared a video on Sunday to celebrate seven years since the release of SS Rajamouli's 'Baahubali: The Beginning'. The film features Prabhas, Rana Daggubati, Anushka Shetty and Tamannaah Bhatia. 'Baahubali: The Beginning' won the National Award for the Best Feature film in 2016 and director Rajamouli won the Filmfare Best Director-Telugu Award.

268.title: Will win a Grand Slam for sure: Jabeur after loss in Wimbledon final
268.article_body: Following her loss in Wimbledon final, world number two Ons Jabeur said she knows that she will come back and win a Grand Slam for sure. Notably, the 27-year-old became the first African woman and first Arab player to reach a Grand Slam final in the Open Era. World number 23 Elena Rybakina beat Jabeur 3-6, 6-2, 6-2 on Saturday.

269.title: It's difficult for star kids in beginning, for outsiders there's no baggage: Raima
269.article_body: Actress Raima Sen said that initially when she joined the industry, people had a lot of expectations from her. "I was Moon Moon Sen's daughter. Being a star kid, people had...expected a lot out of me, they had already judged me, criticised me," she added. "It's...difficult for...star kids in...beginning. For a newcomer who's an outsider, there's no baggage," Raima said.

270.title: Amit ji did something very surprising for the film: Director R Balki on 'Chup'
270.article_body: Filmmaker R Balki said actor Amitabh Bachchan, who unveiled the teaser of his film 'Chup', did something very surprising for the film. "That's his way of telling me how much he liked the film. It is a very different thing to do, unlike common people," he added.  "He actually did something...beautiful, something which has never been done before," Balki said.

271.title: I used to think will I be able to perform with my artificial limb: Sudhaa
271.article_body: Speaking about starting her journey with her artificial limb, dancer and actress Sudhaa Chandran said, "In...past...I was thinking 'Will I be able to dance with my artificial limb?' And if I'm unable to perform to the expectations of the people, what would happen?" "I decided to concentrate on myself and exhibit my talent, not to prove it," she added.

272.title: Telangana shuts all educational institutions for 3 days amid rainfall alert
272.article_body: Telangana CM K Chandrashekar Rao on Sunday announced that all educational institutions in the state will remain closed for the next three days, in view of heavy rainfall. Rao has directed concerned authorities to stay alert and take necessary action in this regard. The India Meteorological Department (IMD) has issued a red alert from Sunday night to Tuesday morning.

273.title: These are rumours: Cong leader on reports of Goa MLAs joining BJP
273.article_body: Goa Congress leader Michael Lobo has denied rumours of any party MLA joining the BJP. "These are all rumours. There's nothing as such. The Assembly session is starting and one rumour has to be spread by somebody or the other," he said. Three Goa Congress MLAs have reportedly skipped a party meeting.

274.title: New forest conservation rules will disempower tribals: Cong
274.article_body: The Congress on Sunday alleged that the new forest conservation rules will disempower crores of 'Adivasis' and others living in forest areas. "Once forest clearance is granted, everything else becomes a mere formality and almost inevitably, no claims will be recognised and settled," said Congress general secretary Jairam Ramesh. New rules have been promulgated without any consultation, he added.

275.title: I want to have a daughter with my wife Alia Bhatt: Ranbir Kapoor
275.article_body: Ranbir Kapoor appeared on the show 'Ravivaar with Star Parivaar' with co-star Vaani Kapoor and took parenting tips from Anupamaa's Rupali Ganguly. In a short promo of the episode shared by the makers on Instagram, Ranbir interacts with the actors of 'Anupamaa' and can also be heard saying that he wants to have a daughter with his wife Alia Bhatt.

276.title: Man threatens Singapore PM on social media post about Abe, arrested
276.article_body: Authorities in Singapore have arrested a 45-year-old man for inciting violence after the accused posted a comment against PM Lee Hsien Loong on social media, reports stated on Saturday. The threat was reportedly found in the comments section of a post on ex-Japan PM Shinzo Abe's assassination. Police seized a laptop, a tablet and four mobile phones from the accused.

277.title: Psoriasis broke out over my body, I got psoriatic arthritis: Kardashian on Met Gala diet
277.article_body: American media personality Kim Kardashian has revealed that she suffered from severe "psoriatic arthritis" after following a diet to fit into the iconic Marilyn Monroe gown during the 2022 Met Gala event. "Psoriasis broke out over my body...so I couldn't really move my hands. I had to go to a rheumatologist who put me on a steroid," she stated.

278.title: SRK waves at fans from Mannat's balcony on Eid with son AbRam
278.article_body: Actor Shah Rukh Khan came out to the balcony of his Mumbai residence Mannat to wish fans on the occasion of Eid-al-Adha on Sunday. The actor was accompanied by his younger son AbRam who was wearing a red T-shirt along with black pants. Pictures and videos of Shah Rukh and AbRam waving at fans are going viral on social media.

279.title: Indian startup funding declines 40% to $6.8 billion in Q2: Report
279.article_body: After three consecutive quarters of raising over $10 billion, the total funding in Indian startups declined 40% during the April-June quarter to reach $6.8 billion, a report by PwC India revealed. It said, "The decline can be attributed to a global slowdown...decrease in tech stock valuations, inflation and geopolitical instability." Early-stage deals comprised over 60% of total funding, it added.

280.title: 8 dead, 82 infected after Japanese Encephalitis outbreak in Assam
280.article_body: At least eight persons have died and 82 others have been infected with Japanese Encephalitis in flood-hit Assam in the past nine days. The state Health Department has asked district authorities to constitute District Rapid Response Teams (DRRT) by July 16 and keep a close watch on the situation. The National Health Mission has issued guidelines to tackle the situation.

281.title: They're running out of time: Vaughan on England after T20I losses vs India
281.article_body: After England fell behind 0-2 in the three-match T20I series following their loss in second T20I against India, Michael Vaughan said, "They haven't been doing well in this [T20I] format for a while." He added, "I don't think they're quite getting the combinations right. They're running out of time. It's the batting that just hasn't clicked for quite some time."

282.title: India releases statement as protestors burn Sri Lanka PM’s home, enter Prez's palace
282.article_body: India has released a statement after protestors in Sri Lanka's Colombo entered the Presidential palace and set PM Ranil Wickremesinghe's private residence on fire amid economic crisis. Stating that India is Sri Lanka's closest neighbour, the government said, "We have stood with the Sri Lankan people...India has extended this year itself an unprecedented support of over $3.8 billion."

283.title: Extremely heavy rainfall warning in several states tomorrow; IMD releases list
283.article_body: IMD has predicted isolated extremely heavy rainfall in Telangana, Gujarat, Maharashtra, Goa, coastal Karnataka, coastal Andhra Pradesh and Chhattisgarh on Monday. Red alert has been issued for several areas in these states. Meanwhile, very heavy rainfall is expected over Uttarakhand, Madhya Pradesh and interior Karnataka on Monday, according to IMD.

284.title: Japan votes for key polls days after ex-PM Abe's assassination
284.article_body: Japanese voters on Sunday cast their ballots in parliamentary election for the upper house, two days after ex-PM Shinzo Abe was assassinated while campaigning in Nara. Abe was shot while campaigning for a candidate from his Liberal Democratic Party. "We must never allow violence to suppress speech during elections, which are the foundation of democracy," Japan PM Fumio Kishida said.

285.title: Motherhood is an honour, it made me a complete artiste: Neeti Mohan
285.article_body: Singer Neeti Mohan has stated in an interview that motherhood is an honour, adding that she feels more complete as an artiste. The singer further said, "Motherhood has made me a better time manager, it has made me more productive." Neeti and her husband actor Nihaar Pandya welcomed their first child Aryaveer on June 2, 2021.

286.title: Dressing up not a crime: Assam CM as man dressed as Shiva gets arrested
286.article_body: After a man was arrested in Assam's Nagaon for allegedly hurting religious sentiments by playing Lord Shiva in a street play, Chief Minister Himanta Biswa Sarma tweeted, "Dressing up is not a crime unless offensive material is said." "Nukkad natak (street play) on current issues is not blasphemous...Appropriate order has been issued to Nagaon Police," Sarma added.

287.title: TN CM 'anti-Hindu', practices religion-based politics: BJP leader
287.article_body: BJP leader K Laxman on Sunday alleged that Tamil Nadu CM MK Stalin was "anti-Hindu" and accused him of practising "religion-based politics". "Stalin who always opposes Hindutva should understand that religion is man's belief and faith and PM Narendra Modi has never linked religion with politics," he said. BJP has never done politics based on religion, he added.

288.title: Man's skull explodes after he lights firework on his head in US
288.article_body: A 43-year-old man, Pablo Ruiz, died in US' Texas after he lit a firework on top of his head recently. Investigators believe the firework exploded from the bottom of the tube and pierced the top of his skull. His friend, who witnessed the incident, said Ruiz had been drinking when he lit the mortar-style firework from his head.

289.title: Dalit boy gets ₹2.5cr scholarship to study in US, is son of daily wager from Bihar
289.article_body: A 17-year-old Dalit boy from Bihar has been awarded a ₹2.5 crore scholarship to study at the US' Lafayette College. Prem Kumar, who is the son of a daily wage worker, is one among only six students selected from across the world for the prestigious 'Dyer Fellowship'. Kumar will fly to Pennsylvania to study Mechanical Engineering and International Relations.

290.title: 53 Shiv Sena MLAs of Shinde, Thackeray factions get show-cause notices
290.article_body: Maharashtra Legislature Secretary has issued show-cause notices to 53 of the state's 55 Shiv Sena MLAs – 39 of Eknath Shinde-led faction and 14 of Uddhav Thackeray camp. Both factions have accused each other of defying the party whip during the Speaker's election and trust vote on July 3 and 4, respectively, seeking disqualification of the legislators from both sides.

291.title: Was once hit on by a girl in Goa, felt nice about it: Taapsee Pannu
291.article_body: Actress Taapsee Pannu revealed that she was once hit on by a girl in Goa. "I didn't realise it first...my friends told me...'she's hitting on you'," Taapsee said, adding, "I think I felt nice...because you always think...girls only find faults in other girls...So it was like she finds me nice, oh nice...I felt nice about it at that point."

292.title: It's sad Wimbledon didn't have 2nd semis, but Nadal knows his body: Djokovic
292.article_body: Reacting to Rafael Nadal pulling out of Wimbledon due to an abdominal injury, Novak Djokovic said it's sad that the tournament didn't have a second semi-final but Nadal knows "his body the best". He added, "I give Nadal a lot of credit for the way he fought and won...with that injury." Nadal had won quarter-final despite a seven millimetre tear.

293.title: UP govt taking measures to ban sale of meat in open on Kanwar Yatra routes
293.article_body: The Uttar Pradesh government is taking measures to restrict the sale of meat in open along the routes fixed for Kanwar Yatra. The local, district and police administration are reaching out to meat traders to ensure this, said officials. This year, the Kanwar Yatra will take place after a gap of two years due to the COVID-19 outbreak.

294.title: Elon Musk is a bullsh*t artist, he's not going to buy Twitter: Donald Trump
294.article_body: Former US President Donald Trump called Tesla CEO Elon Musk a "bullsh*t artist" and claimed that Musk isn't going to buy Twitter. "He's got a pretty rotten contract, I looked at his contract," Trump said, referring to Musk's $44 billion merger contract to buy Twitter. On Saturday, Musk terminated the deal to acquire Twitter citing several reasons, including spam accounts.

295.title: Video shows protesters counting cash they found at Sri Lanka President's mansion
295.article_body: A video has surfaced on social media which purportedly shows anti-government protesters in Sri Lanka counting the cash that they claimed were found at the President's official residence. Notably, protesters who stormed President Gotabaya Rajapaksa's mansion on Saturday claimed to have recovered "millions of rupees" from his residence amid the country's worst economic crisis.

296.title: I find people asking me more about 'Koffee with...' than about my films: Johar
296.article_body: Filmmaker Karan Johar, while speaking about his show 'Koffee With Karan', said, "I find people asking me more about 'Koffee With Karan' than about my movies, which I take as...compliment at that moment." "So while one part of me is elated, one part of me also needs to...make sure that the filmmaker...graph needs to move forward too," he added.

297.title: US Bitcoin mining firm Compass fires 15% staff, cuts exec pay by 50%
297.article_body: US-based Bitcoin mining company Compass Mining has fired 15% of its staff, Co-founders Thomas Heller and Paul Gosker announced. The company's senior employees and executive team have taken pay cuts of up to 50%, they added. This comes amid the falling price of Bitcoin. "Given recent market downturn...we had to take a hard look at our spend," the Co-founders said.

298.title: D-Mart owner Avenue Supermarts' profit jumps 490% to ₹680 cr in Q1
298.article_body: D-Mart owner and operator Avenue Supermarts reported a profit after tax (PAT) of almost ₹680 crore in Q1 of Financial Year 2023, after marking a jump of around 490% from ₹115.13 crore year-on-year. The Mumbai-based company also reported over 94% increase in its revenue from operations which came in at ₹9,806.89 crore.

299.title: Prabhas weighed 100 kg for 'Baahubali', had 8 meals a day: Trainer
299.article_body: Professional bodybuilder Laxman Reddy spoke about how Prabhas trained to play the role of Amarendra Baahubali in the 'Baahubali' films. "Prabhas weighed almost 100 kg," he said adding that the actor used to have eight meals a day. "In the evenings, we had weight training sessions, which included deadlifts, squats, bench press, and other rigorous exercises," said Reddy.

300.title: China fines Alibaba, Tencent for violating anti-monopoly rules
300.article_body: China imposed fines on Alibaba and Tencent along with other firms for failing to comply with anti-monopoly rules on disclosure of transactions. China's State Administration for Market Regulation released a list of 28 deals that violated the rules, out of which five involved Alibaba and 12 involved Tencent. The maximum potential fine in each case stands at $74,688, Reuters reported.

301.title: End voting rights for Muslims if they aren't allowed to vote: Khan
301.article_body: The right to vote for Muslims should be ended if community members are not allowed to exercise this right, said Samajwadi Party leader Azam Khan. His remark came in the backdrop of bypolls for Rampur and Azamgarh Lok Sabha constituencies, during which Muslim voters were harassed and the total voting percentage in the Rampur district was only 32%, claimed Khan.

302.title: 'Agnipath' complements IAF’s long-term vision of ‘lean & lethal’ force: IAF chief
302.article_body: Air Chief Marshal VR Chaudhari said the 'Agnipath' scheme complements IAF's long-term vision of being a "lean and lethal" force with the best manpower. "We strongly believe that the men and women behind the machine make all the difference when it matters," he added. He said that 13 teams will take care of enrolment, employment, assessment and training of recruits.

303.title: Man cheats 200 people of ₹1.5 lakh each in Hyderabad, arrested
303.article_body: Hyderabad's Medipally Police have arrested a 35-year-old man accused of cheating 200 people of ₹1.5 lakh each on pretext of a business scam. According to police, the accused, identified as Adula Bala Swamy Goud, had sold machinery used to make cotton wicks to victims and promised to buy the products. Goud sold the machines to victims at ₹1.5 lakh each.

304.title: They enjoyed luxury, we suffered: SL woman as protesters occupy president's home
304.article_body: A 61-year-old handkerchief seller in Sri Lanka who entered the president's palace in Colombo after it was stormed by protesters on Saturday, said, "I've never seen a place like this in my life." She added, "They enjoyed super luxury while we suffered. We were hoodwinked." President and PM's houses have been occupied amid Sri Lanka's worst economic crisis since independence.

305.title: I think Rafael Nadal didn't want to face Kyrgios at 80%: McEnroe
305.article_body: Ex-world number one John McEnroe has said Rafael Nadal pulled out of Wimbledon 2022 because he didn't want to face Nick Kyrgios in the semi-final. "Nadal beat Taylor Fritz at 80%...but Kyrgios is dominating Wimbledon...do you really think Rafael wanted to play him at 80%? Something tells me he didn't want that," stated McEnroe. Nadal had suffered an abdominal tear.

306.title: 5 armed men barge into Haryana Cong MLA's house, beat up his cook
306.article_body: Five armed men allegedly barged into Congress MLA Kuldeep Vats' house in Haryana's Pataudi and beat up his cook, police said. Police added that a case has been registered against the accused. "They told me to warn the MLA that he should not make any comments against gangsters or he will face the fate as Sidhu Moosewala," the cook said.

307.title: Impartial judicial system biggest need for democracy: Nitin Gadkari
307.article_body: Union Minister Nitin Gadkari said that an impartial and fair judicial system is the biggest requirement for a free and fair democracy. "During cabinet meetings...I often tell the law minister and prime minister that whatever the decision may be, it is the right of the judiciary to give the decision and it should not be influenced by anybody," he said.

308.title: Babul Supriyo appointed as Trinamool Congress' national spokesperson
308.article_body: Trinamool Congress (TMC) appointed its MLA Babul Supriyo as the national spokesperson of the party. Taking to Twitter, the former union minister thanked TMC chief Mamata Banerjee and TMC's National General Secretary Abhishek Banerjee and wrote, "Shall do my very best to live up to the responsibility entrusted upon me." In April, Supriyo won Ballygunge assembly seat on TMC's ticket.

309.title: 1Pay gets RBI's in-principle nod to operate as payment aggregator
309.article_body: Fintech startup 1Pay Mobileware has become one of the first companies in India to receive in-principle approval from RBI to operate as a payment aggregator. The company is backed by ex-Goldman Sachs MD Sanjiv Shah, and Sanjay Gaitonde. "1Pay is creating...payments platform for the unorganised sector that empowers them to accept and make digital payments," the firm's Co-founder Gaitonde said.

310.title: History-sheeter arrested for trying to extort ₹1 cr from Pune jeweller
310.article_body: A 28-year-old history-sheeter was arrested for allegedly trying to extort ₹1 crore from a jeweller in Pune district's Shirur. The accused made the extortion call using a phone he had stolen from a Pandharpur-bound Warkari. He allegedly said that he was calling from "DK Group" and threatened to kill the jeweller and his family members if the money wasn't given.

311.title: WhatsApp to let users sync chats across multiple smartphones: Report
311.article_body: According to a report by WABetaInfo, online messaging platform WhatsApp will soon let users sync their chats across multiple smartphones. This would allow users to use the same WhatsApp number or account on different smartphones without requiring to have an active internet connection on their primary phone, the report added. Currently, users can only sync chats on tablets and desktops.

312.title: SpiceXpress to be hived off from SpiceJet by August 1st week: CMD
312.article_body: SpiceJet CMD Ajay Singh has said banks and shareholders have given their approval to hive off cargo and logistics company SpiceXpress from SpiceJet airline. The bifurcation will take place by the first week of August, he added. This comes after SpiceJet said in August 2021 it was transferring its logistics business on a slump sale basis to its subsidiary SpiceXpress.

313.title: We have won Wimbledon: Russian tennis chief on Kazakh player Rybakina's win
313.article_body: Russian Tennis Federation (RTF) president Shamil Tarpishchev claimed credit for Kazakh player Elena Rybakina's women's singles title win at Wimbledon. "It's very nice. Well done Rybakina. We've won Wimbledon," Tarpishchev said. Rybakina, born and brought up in Russia's Moscow, switched nationalities to Kazakhstan in 2018. Notably, Russian players were banned from participating in Wimbledon.

314.title: Paintings, sculptures worth ₹40 crore seized by CBI in DHFL bank fraud case
314.article_body: The CBI seized paintings and sculptures worth ₹40 crore during its searches at three locations in connection with India's biggest banking fraud of ₹34,615 crore by DHFL. The seized artworks reportedly include paintings by famous artists Tyeb Mehta and Manjit Bawa, worth ₹27 crore and ₹7.7 crore, respectively. Promoters allegedly bought artworks worth ₹55 crore using diverted funds, CBI said.

315.title: Congress expresses solidarity with Sri Lanka and its people: Sonia Gandhi
315.article_body: A day after the protests against economic crisis reached a peak in Sri Lanka, Congress chief Sonia Gandhi on Sunday issued a statement, saying the Congress party expresses its solidarity with Sri Lanka and its people in this moment of grave crisis. "We hope that India will continue to assist the people and government of Sri Lanka," the statement read.

316.title: India's economy needs to grow 8-10% in 25 years: Singapore minister
316.article_body: Singapore's Senior Minister and Coordinating Minister for Social Policies Tharman Shanmugaratnam said that India's economy must grow by 8-10% in the next 25 years to raise the average income of people across the country and create more jobs. Shanmugaratnam added that India needs to focus simultaneously not only on job growth but also on productivity.

317.title: Withdrawal rate falls as FPIs take out ₹4,000 crore in July so far
317.article_body: The pace of selling by foreign portfolio investors (FPIs) has declined as they withdrew over ₹4,000 crore from Indian equity markets in the first eight days of July. This comes after a net withdrawal of ₹50,203 crore in June, the highest net outflow since March 2020. Recently, the RBI announced several measures to boost foreign exchange inflows.

318.title: Hero MotoCorp CEO Munjal steps down as CII President-Designate
318.article_body: Hero MotoCorp Chairman and CEO Pawan Munjal has stepped down as President-Designate of the Confederation of Indian Industry (CII) for 2022-23. Munjal cited domestic and global business commitments as the reason behind stepping down. The CII has elected TVS Group's R Dinesh as Munjal's replacement. ITC Chairman and MD Sanjiv Puri has been elected as Vice President.

319.title: Refrain from commenting about Musk's deal: Twitter to staff as it vows legal action
319.article_body: Twitter has asked its staff to not publicly comment about Elon Musk's $44 billion collapsed deal. Citing it as an ongoing legal matter, it said employees "should refrain from Tweeting, Slacking, or sharing any commentary" about the merger agreement. Meanwhile, Twitter Chairman Bret Taylor said the board will pursue legal action against Musk to enforce the merger.

320.title: Metallica pays tribute to 'Stranger Things' character Eddie Munson
320.article_body: Heavy metal band Metallica recently paid a tribute to television series 'Stranger Things' character Eddie Munson which is portrayed by actor Joseph Quinn. The series featured Eddie performing the band's song 'Master of Puppets' in an episode. Metallica posted a video on TikTok and Instagram recording a duet of performing the song along with the clip of Eddie's performance.

321.title: No pressure now, Rohit & Virat can take time to score: Parthiv on 3rd Eng T20I
321.article_body: Ex-India wicketkeeper-batter Parthiv Patel has said the third and final T20I against England is a good opportunity for Rohit Sharma and Virat Kohli to take time and score "big runs". "Rohit is looking good, but he's not able to convert 30s. As for Kohli, the runs are not coming," stated Parthiv. Kohli scored 1(3) in the second England T20I.

322.title: Seems someone is forcing him to go, hit: Ajay Jadeja on Kohli's dismissal
322.article_body: Talking about Virat Kohli's dismissal in second T20I against England, Ajay Jadeja said, "The way we saw Kohli today, it seems someone is forcing him to go and hit, we've not seen this for 15 years." Richard Gleeson removed Kohli(1) after the India batter hit the ball high in the air, with Dawid Malan taking the catch at backward point.

323.title: Delhi sets up control room to monitor plastic ban, ₹1 lakh fine
323.article_body: The Delhi Pollution Control Committee has set up a control room to monitor the implementation of the ban on single-use plastic items and will start fining those violating it from Monday, officials said. The action will include a fine of up to ₹1 lakh or a jail term of up to five years, under the Environment Protection Act, 1986.

324.title: Never thought my career was over: Bhuvneshwar on facing injuries
324.article_body: India bowler Bhuvneshwar Kumar recalled his injury woes before making his India comeback and said he never thought his career was over. "I was working with the physios, trainers...doing my thing...when you're out of the game you're never confident," he stated. "Luckily...(I'm) playing for India again," he added. Bhuvneshwar was Player of the Match in the second T20I versus England.

325.title: India sends 44,000 MT urea to Sri Lanka to curb food crisis
325.article_body: India on Sunday handed more than 44,000 metric tonnes (MT) of urea to Sri Lanka amid latter's economic crisis. The assistance, which is part of India's credit line to the country, is aimed at supporting Sri Lankan farmers, the Indian High Commissioner to Sri Lanka said. Over 6 million Sri Lankans are facing food insecurity amid inflation, UN has said.

326.title: 3 arrested for spreading 'fake news' on Jagannath Rath Yatra via YouTube
326.article_body: Three youths were arrested from Gujarat for allegedly spreading "fake news" on YouTube channels about an attack on Jagannath Rath Yatra. The social media monitoring cell of Cyber Crime Branch came across YouTube channels, while keeping a watch on various platforms on July 2. There was an attempt to disturb peace and social harmony through YouTube channels, the police said.

327.title: Rare 'rain of animals' witnessed in Telangana's Jagtial; video surfaces
327.article_body: Residents of Telangana's Jagtial town witnessed a rare weather phenomenon as fish rained from the sky. 'Rain of animals' is a phenomenon that occurs when small water animals like frogs, crabs, and fish are swept up in waterspouts or drafts that occur on the surface of the earth. They are then rained down at the same time as the rain.

328.title: 6 killed as rockets hit apartment building in Ukraine's Donbas
328.article_body: At least six people were killed and over 30 people are feared trapped after Russian rockets hit a five-storey residential building in Chasiv Yar, a city in Ukraine's Donbas region, regional governor has said. The strike, which reportedly took place on Saturday, comes even as Russia denies deliberately attacking civilians. Notably, several regions of Donbas are now under Russian control.

329.title: Blessings of Goddess Kali are always with India: PM Modi
329.article_body: PM Narendra Modi, while addressing the centenary celebrations of Swami Atmasthananda on Sunday, said the blessings of Goddess Kali are always with the country. This comes amid a controversy over TMC MP Mahua Moitra's remarks on Goddess Kali, following which BJP filed several police complaints against her. "To me, Kali is a meat-eating and alcohol-accepting Goddess," Moitra had earlier said.

330.title: Protesters enact WWE on Sri Lanka Prime Minister's bed, video goes viral
330.article_body: A video has gone viral showing protesters enacting WWE on a bed at Sri Lanka Prime Minister's residence. In the video, several intruders can be seen imitating wrestling moves, while others can be seen cheering them up. Sri Lanka Prime Minister Ranil Wickremesinghe on Saturday announced that he is resigning from his post amid the economic crisis in the country.

331.title: BJP trying to poach our MLAs, intimidate them: AICC Goa in-charge
331.article_body: AICC Goa in-charge Dinesh Gundu Rao on Sunday said, "All the MLAs of Congress party are intact but BJP is trying to poach our MLAs and intimidate them." Furthermore, he said, "Yesterday we had a CLP meeting in Goa…All our MLAs are intact." Meanwhile, Goa Congress leader Michael Lobo refuted the "rumours" that few Congress leaders are joining BJP.

332.title: Film initiative started by TN govt, movies to be shown in 13,000 schools
332.article_body: The Tamil Nadu government has launched an initiative to screen films in government schools. In the state's 13,210 schools, a nodal teacher would facilitate the process. The nodal teacher has to prepare a synopsis of the film and ensure the screening meets all criteria. "The government had initiated counselling programmes to improve [kids'] mental health," Minister for School Education said.

333.title: When he collared me & asked why I'm not making Paani: Shekhar on pic with Cruise
333.article_body: Filmmaker Shekhar Kapur has shared a throwback picture of himself with Tom Cruise from the time the actor visited India in 2011. Sharing the picture, Shekhar wrote, "When #TomCruise collared me and asked...why I'm not making #Paani." The picture was reportedly clicked at a party organised by Anil Kapoor while Tom was in India to promote 'Mission Impossible: Ghost Protocol'.

334.title: No justification provided: Pak's Imad Wasim on losing central contract
334.article_body: Pakistan all-rounder Imad Wasim said no justification has been given to him as to why he didn't get a central contract from Pakistan Cricket Board. "Reasons are given to me, but I'm unsatisfied with them," he added. "One reason given to me was regarding the positive influence on the team. I don't think I have a negative influence," he stated.

335.title: Pune to have normal water supply till July 26: PMC
335.article_body: PMC has decided to continue its normal supply till July 26 after water storage in the four dams supplying water to Pune increased to over 7 TMC, officials said on Sunday. PMC had previously said it will start an alternate day water supply from July 4 to July 11 because of the deficit rain in June.

336.title: Man threatens IAS officer over son-in-law's transfer from B'luru; held
336.article_body: A man has been arrested from Bengaluru for allegedly making threat calls to IAS officer Munish Moudgil over his driver's transfer to Kolar. Moudgil's driver is the son-in-law of the accused. The accused had posed as Karnataka Excise Minister K Gopalaiah's personal secretary and threatened to transfer the officer from his present department and started shouting at him.

337.title: Ebden and Purcell win Wimbledon men's doubles title in 4 hours 11 minutes
337.article_body: Australia's Matt Ebden and Max Purcell defeated defending champions Mate Pavic and Nikola Mektic of Croatia 7-6(7-5), 6-7(3-7), 4-6, 6-4, 7-6(10-2) to win their first Grand Slam men's doubles title at Wimbledon on Saturday. They won the final in four hours 11 minutes. Ebden and Purcell saved a total of eight match points on the way to winning the title.

338.title: Thanks Farah Ma for having faith in me when no one did: Deepika
338.article_body: Filmmaker Farah Khan recently took to Instagram Stories to share an advertisement of actress Deepika Padukone for a luxury brand in Bangkok, writing, "Looking good baby." Deepika shared the post on her story, writing, "Thank you Ma! YOU had faith in me when no one else did." Deepika made her Bollywood debut in Farah's 2007 film 'Om Shanti Om'.

339.title: Team India have got something going on at the right time: Vaughan
339.article_body: After India's win in the two T20Is against England, ex-cricketer Michael Vaughan said, "It's the first time I'm seeing India thinking that they can carry on with this mindset, aggression and skill-set with the ball in hand." He added, "They've got something going on at the right time." India were 89/5 but scored 170/8 in the second T20I against England.

340.title: Protesters work out in presidential palace gym in Sri Lanka, videos go viral
340.article_body: Protesters in Sri Lanka were seen crowding the gym at the presidential palace in Colombo after storming the property on Saturday. Videos from inside the gym, showing protesters working out on treadmills and lifting weights, have gone viral online. Footage from inside the palace has also shown protesters in the swimming pool, kitchen and other areas.

341.title: 17-yr-old Navi Mumbai boy drowns while swimming in well with friends
341.article_body: A 17-year-old boy from Navi Mumbai's Digha died after drowning while swimming in a well in the Kargil Hill area of Kalwa East. "The deceased...had gone swimming in the well along with his six friends," an official said. According to the official, the boy was unable to gauge the depth of the well, which is approximately 30-35 feet.

342.title: PT assistant inappropriately touches, molests 14 girls in school in Pune; held
342.article_body: An 18-year-old physical training assistant has been arrested in Pune for allegedly molesting 14 girls from Class 8 to 10 during PT sessions held inside school, police said. Officers said the man has been accused of inappropriately touching the girls, passing inappropriate comments and also threatening them. The school principal informed the police after girls' complaints.

343.title: Ritesh shares pics with Salman as he finishes filming directorial debut 'Ved'
343.article_body: Actor-filmmaker Ritesh Deshmukh shared a series of pictures with actor Salman Khan on social media as he finished filming his Marathi directorial debut 'Ved'. He wrote, "I have no words to express my gratitude for the grace and kindness [Salman] has shown towards (my wife) Genelia (Deshmukh) and me." Salman will be making a cameo appearance in the upcoming film.

344.title: I'm worried Hardik will be expected to bowl 10 overs in ODIs: Manjrekar
344.article_body: Ex-India cricketer Sanjay Manjrekar has said he's not sure if it's a "great call" to include all-rounder Hardik Pandya in the ODI squad for the England series. "I'm a little worried if Hardik plays 50-overs cricket and is expected to bowl 10 overs...ODI [are] tough," stated Manjrekar. Hardik picked a wicket and scored 12(15) in the second T20I against England.

345.title: Man demands ₹1 cr from Pune RTO officer to withdraw case; arrested
345.article_body: A man has been arrested for allegedly demanding ₹1 crore from Regional Transport Officer (RTO) to withdraw a police complaint lodged in 2019. Six RTO officials and staffers were booked back then for their alleged role in transferring a truck on forged documents. The accused had demanded the amount to withdraw the complaint.

346.title: Bag with coins, God idol & jewellery found outside BJP leader's Mumbai home
346.article_body: The Mumbai Police found a bag full of coins, cash, idol of God and jewellery outside the house of the Bhartiya Janata Party leader Prasad Lad. Officials told news agency ANI that the bag was dropped off in front of Lad's house by a man around 5:30 am on Sunday. Reports said motive of act is yet to be established.

347.title: Mind-blowing to see people cheering after my crash at Austrian GP: Hamilton
347.article_body: F1 driver Lewis Hamilton has reacted to fans cheering after he crashed during the qualifying race at the Austrian Grand Prix. "It's just mind-blowing that people would do that, knowing how dangerous our sport is...You should never cheer someone's downfall or someone's injury," he stated. The Mercedes driver will begin the race on Sunday in eighth place.
