348.title: Heart cried slightly: Aakash on Kohli replacing Hooda in 2nd T20I vs Eng
348.article_body: Ex-India cricketer Aakash Chopra, speaking about Virat Kohli replacing Deepak Hooda in the second T20I against England, has said, "The heart cried for Hooda slightly because he has consistently done well." "I am sure Hooda's name is there in the ODI series against West Indies...he'll play there but it is not possible to not feel for him," he added.

349.title: Our villages showed they cannot only bring change but also lead change: PM
349.article_body: PM Narendra Modi on Sunday addressed the Natural Farming Conclave and said our villages have shown that they cannot only bring a change but also lead the change. "The extraordinary success of the Digital India Mission is the country's reply to those people who used to say that it's not easy to bring change to villages," he added.

350.title: Hyd man arrested for issuing death threats to BJP MP Pragya Thakur
350.article_body: Madhya Pradesh Police have arrested a Hyderabad resident for allegedly threatening BJP MP Pragya Singh Thakur last month, an official said. The accused, identified as Sheikh Nazir, was nabbed by authorities at the Delhi airport on Thursday and then taken to Bhopal for questioning. Nazir had allegedly called Thakur from an international number and issued death threats to her.

351.title: Abe could've survived, there was a life-saving gap between two shots: Mahindra
351.article_body: Businessman Anand Mahindra took to Twitter to claim that former Japan PM Shinzo Abe could have survived the assassination. "There was a potentially life-saving gap until the second shot. Shouldn't his security have jumped on Abe...and covered him," Mahindra asked. Retired IPS officer Muktesh Chander replied, "I have been in-charge of security...of 5 different PMs and ex-PMs...I definitely agree."

352.title: Man held for trying to kill woman who denied him space in Delhi's footpath
352.article_body: A 42-year-old man has been arrested for trying to kill a woman after she refused to leave space for him to sleep on a footpath, the Delhi Police said. The police rushed to the spot after they received information that a woman is lying unconscious with head injury near Lady Hardinge Hospital's gate number three, DCP Amrutha Guguloth said.

353.title: Assam man dressed as Lord Shiva for street play on fuel rate arrested
353.article_body: A man who played Lord Shiva in a street play in Assam's Nagaon has been arrested for allegedly hurting religious sentiments. The arrested man was protesting against rising fuel prices and unemployment through the street play, news agency ANI reported. Police said that he will be presented in the court, while two others are yet to be caught.

354.title: Protesters find high-security bunker in President's palace in Sri Lanka; video viral
354.article_body: Protestors in Sri Lanka found a high-security bunker in the Presidential palace in the country, a video of which is going viral on social media. Video shows several people entering the bunker. Earlier, videos and pictures from the palace showed protesters on President Gotabaya Rajapaksa's bed, jumping in the pool and taking a shower among other things.

355.title: Novak Djokovic, Nick Kyrgios' Instagram chat ahead of Wimbledon final goes viral
355.article_body: Novak Djokovic and Nick Kyrgios' chat on Instagram ahead of their Wimbledon final went viral. Kyrgios asked Djokovic on Instagram Stories if they were friends now, to which Djokovic responded, "If you are inviting me for a drink or dinner, I accept. PS: Winner [of the final] pays." Kyrgios then replied, "Deal, let's go to a nightclub and go nuts."

356.title: IFS officer shares pic of fake appointment letter people received; issues warning
356.article_body: IFS officer Parveen Kaswan has shared a picture of fake appointment letter of Indian Forest Service received by some people. "Friends some people are getting such appointment letters. Please don't deposit any fees. They are fake. Even reading few lines will make you understand," he warned people. "Shocking. They are also using fake stamp and seal," a Twitter user reacted.

357.title: Anupam wraps up 'Kaagaz 2' shoot in Lucknow, thanks UP CM Yogi Adityanath
357.article_body: Anupam Kher has completed shooting for his upcoming film 'Kaagaz 2' in Lucknow, Uttar Pradesh. He took to Instagram on Sunday to share the news and thanked UP Chief Minister Yogi Adityanath for "facilitating [the] shoot so smoothly". "It was an absolute pleasure to shoot here," he further wrote. Anupam also shared some pictures from the sets.

358.title: Bobby Deol, Kajol hold special screening as 'Gupt' completes 25 years
358.article_body: Actors Bobby Deol and Kajol reunited on Saturday in Mumbai for a special screening of their 1997 film 'Gupt: The Hidden Truth' which completed 25 years of release. The film also stars Manisha Koirala who was not seen at the screening. Kajol received the Best Actor in a Negative Role award for the film at the 1998 Filmfare Awards.

359.title: 66,000 liquor bottles worth ₹2 cr seized, destroyed in Andhra's Kurnool
359.article_body: Special Enforcement Bureau (SEB) seized and destroyed 66,000 liquor bottles worth ₹2 crore, in 593 cases registered in 2021-2022, in Andhra Pradesh's Kurnool. The SEB said that the liquor bottles were destroyed on the road near the railway bridge on the way from Panchalingala village to Tandrapadu village in Kurnool.

360.title: School teacher molests woman inside Delhi metro station's lift, booked
360.article_body: A 33-year-old school teacher was arrested from Delhi's IP Extension metro station for allegedly molesting a female teacher from a different school. Police said the accused had been harassing her for a long time. The incident took place when he allegedly followed her inside a lift, touched her inappropriately and threatened to kill her if she told anyone about it.

361.title: Boy seen riding horse with Swiggy delivery bag is a horse couturier: Swiggy
361.article_body: Swiggy said that it has identified the boy who was seen riding a horse with its delivery bag in a viral video shot in Mumbai. Saying that the 17-year-old wasn't a delivery executive, Swiggy added, "He's a horse couturier i.e. he takes care of dressing horses for wedding[s]." He was carrying accessories for the horse in the bag, it added.

362.title: Musk talked about Mars, avoided discussing Twitter deal at Sun Valley: Report
362.article_body: Tesla CEO Elon Musk avoided discussing the $44 billion collapsed Twitter deal at Sun Valley, as per people who attended the conference. Musk spent most of his time discussing colonising Mars and the importance of boosting the birth rate on Earth, they said. Sun Valley Conference is an annual media finance conference hosted by private investment firm Allen & Company.

363.title: India supportive of Sri Lanka, no refugee crisis right now: Jaishankar
363.article_body: A day after the protests against economic crisis reached a peak in Sri Lanka, External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar said that the Indian government has always been supportive of the neighbouring country, adding that there is no refugee crisis now. "They are right now working through their problems, so we have to wait and see what they do," he added.

364.title: Sam Wilson will be Captain America: Evans on rumours of returning to MCU
364.article_body: Chris Evans has dismissed rumours of him returning to the Marvel Cinematic Universe (MCU) as Captain America. The actor was reacting to a tweet by The Hollywood Reporter which said it remains "unclear" if he'd return for the fourth instalment of 'Captain America'. "Sam Wilson is Captain America," Evans wrote. Sam Wilson is played by Anthony Mackie in the MCU.

365.title: Nearly 10.05 mn people use digital certificates for pensions: Data
365.article_body: Nearly 10.05 million people, including private citizens and ex-government employees, use digital life certificates to claim pension payments, according to official data. Out of the 10 million, 2.4 million are government pensioners, the data stated. Launched in 2014, digital certificates are verified by Unique Identification Authority of India, which sends it to bank that disburses the pensions.

366.title: Partnership in bowling important: RP Singh on Bumrah & Bhuvneshwar
366.article_body: Ex-India pacer RP Singh said partnership in bowling is "very important" just like in batting. "Bumrah...Bhuvneshwar were a...successful pair a few years back, but their alliance was broken due to injuries (to Bhuvneshwar)," he added. "[In the second T20I versus England], they dismissed key batters in the first six overs...the reward for it was a 49-run win," he concluded.

367.title: I like the idea of Pant opening for Team India: Sehwag
367.article_body: Former India opener Virender Sehwag, while congratulating Team India for their T20I series win against England, said he liked the idea of Rishabh Pant opening the batting in the second T20I. "Fantastic effort by Indian bowlers...like the idea of Pant opening. Congratulations on the wonderful series win," tweeted Sehwag. Pant scored 26(15) alongside Rohit Sharma.

368.title: 14 killed in mass shooting in a bar in South Africa, police call it 'random firing'
368.article_body: As many as 14 people were killed in a mass shooting in a bar in South Africa's Johannesburg's Soweto township. The police stated that a group of men arrived in a minibus taxi and opened fire. Calling it a "random firing", the police stated that a high caliber firearm was used. Three people have also been critically injured.

369.title: EPFO may approve new system to pay pension to over 73 lakh beneficiaries in one go
369.article_body: The Employees' Provident Fund Organisation (EPFO) will consider and approve a proposal for setting up a central pension disbursal system in its upcoming meeting to credit pensions to over 73 lakh beneficiaries' bank accounts in one go across India. Currently, over 138 regional offices of the EPFO disburse pensions in their region separately at different times or days.

370.title: Protesters claim to find millions of rupees at Sri Lanka President's residence: Report
370.article_body: The anti-government protesters who stormed Sri Lanka President Gotabaya Rajapaksa's residence have claimed to have recovered millions of rupees inside his mansion, according to reports.  A video is being shared on social media showing the protesters counting the currency notes that were unearthed. The recovered money was said to be handed over to the security units, the Daily Mirror reported.

371.title: Iran has escalated uranium enrichment at Fordow plant: IAEA report
371.article_body: Iran has increased the enrichment of uranium through advanced machineries at its underground enrichment facility in Fordow, UN's atomic watchdog International Atomic Energy Agency (IAEA) has said in a confidential report accessed by Reuters on Saturday. According to the report, the new setup allows for quicker and easier switch between the enrichment levels of uranium.

372.title: India among favourites for T20 WC 2022: Afridi after 2nd T20I vs Eng
372.article_body: Following India's 49-run win over England in the second T20I, ex-Pakistan skipper Shahid Afridi praised the Indian cricket team and said they played outstanding cricket. On Twitter, he wrote, "Really impressive bowling performance, they'll surely be one of the favourites for the T20 World Cup in Australia." India have taken an unassailable lead in the three-match T20I series against England.

373.title: We discussed Sourav Ganguly's biopic before 'Shabaash...': Srijit Mukherji
373.article_body: 'Shabaash Mithu' director Srijit Mukherji has said that being a cricket fan, he had been trying for a cricket biopic for a long time. "We were discussing possibilities with Sourav Ganguly for the longest time, but that didn't materialise," Srijit stated. 'Shabaash Mithu' is a biopic of ex-India women's captain Mithali Raj, who will be played by actress Taapsee Pannu.

374.title: Muslim society should oppose such incidents vigorously: RSS on Udaipur murder
374.article_body: RSS leader Sunil Ambekar on Saturday condemned the killing of a tailor, Kanhaiya Lal, in Udaipur, saying that the Muslim society should come forward and oppose such incidents "vigorously". "The Hindu society is responding in a peaceful and constitutional way. The Muslim society is also expected to oppose such an incident. Some intellectuals have opposed it," he added.

375.title: She taught me a lot of things, had ringmaster's precision: Urmila on Saroj
375.article_body: Urmila Matondkar, in a recent episode of 'Dance India Dance Super Moms', recalled working with Saroj Khan and said that she learned a lot of things from the late choreographer. "[When]...I started working with Saroj Khan ji, I saw the ringmaster's precision in her and she taught me a lot of things," she said. Saroj passed away in July 2020.

376.title: Really ashamed, mafia came despite police presence: Assam CM on man's death
376.article_body: Assam Chief Minister Himanta Biswa Sarma said he is "really ashamed" after death of Vineet Bagaria who died by suicide due to mafia in state's Dibrugarh area. "Mafia came here despite [police] presence. I've never been more ashamed in my life that such incident could happen when I am serving as the chief minister...I apologise to his parents," he added.

377.title: Team India were a little bit over-par: England's Richard Gleeson
377.article_body: England pacer Richard Gleeson, who made his international debut for England in their 49-run defeat against India, said the Rohit Sharma-led side was a "little over-par". He added, "India started well with the ball...that's always going to put [you] on the back foot...that can be the way T20 goes at times." Gleeson picked three wickets in his four overs.

378.title: Being a parent is tough, I'm learning how to become a better father: Anil
378.article_body: Anil Kapoor has said being a parent is very tough, adding he's learning how to become a better father. "There are many drawbacks in me. I'm not the right person to tell...how to become...better parent," he added. Anil further said he cannot be strict with his children, adding, "You can make...kids do better things with love...You need to have patience."

379.title: CBI, I-T dept raid ex-NBCC officer Mittal's Noida house, seize ₹2 cr
379.article_body: The CBI and Income Tax Department conducted a raid at the residence of DK Mittal, a former National Buildings Construction Corporation (NBCC) officer, in Noida on Saturday. According to ANI, more than ₹2-crore cash and jewellery were recovered from his residence. The CBI has registered a disproportionate assets case against his known sources of income.

380.title: 'Shaktimaan' movie to be helmed by 'Tanhaji' director Om Raut: Report
380.article_body: 'Tanhaji: The Unsung Warrior' director Om Raut will reportedly be directing 'Shaktimaan'. Sony Pictures International Productions, who bought the film adaptation rights of 'Shaktimaan', will be backing the VFX-heavy project. Earlier, it was reported that actor Ranveer Singh will be playing the Indian superhero in the film. Om is currently working on Prabhas-starrer 'Adipurush'.

381.title: This is a fight for Mumbai: Aaditya Thackeray at Aarey protest site
381.article_body: Shiv Sena leader Aaditya Thackeray, who joined the protest opposing metro car shed project in Aarey colony today, said that the protest is a fight for Mumbai and fight for life. "We fought for forest and to protect our tribals," he added. During our tenure, we had proposed construction to be turned into a veterinary hospital for jungle, Thackeray said.

382.title: M-cap of 8 of top 10 most valued firms jumps ₹1.81 lakh crore in past week
382.article_body: Eight of the 10 most valued domestic firms together added ₹1,81,209.89 crore in market valuation last week with Hindustan Unilever emerging as the biggest gainer. While HUL added ₹50,058.05 crore, taking its valuation to ₹5,86,422.74 crore and ICICI Bank's valuation jumped ₹35,956.8 crore to reach ₹5,25,656.96 crore. Reliance Industries and Tata Consultancy Services were among the laggards.

383.title: Sri Lankan Army chief says opportunity to resolve crisis available, urges calm
383.article_body: Sri Lankan Army chief General Shavendra Silva said that an opportunity to resolve the current political crisis in a peaceful manner is now available. He also sought public's support to maintain peace in the nation. His statement came after the violence that took place at Galle Face and Fort and near the private residence of Prime Minister Ranil Wickremesinghe.

384.title: Virat Kohli does bhangra while fielding in the deep, video goes viral
384.article_body: A video of Team India batter Virat Kohli doing bhangra while fielding in the deep during the second T20I against England at Edgbaston in Birmingham has gone viral. In the video, the crowd can be heard singing and beating the dhol with Kohli dancing. India defeated England by 49 runs in the match to take an unassailable 2-0 series lead.

385.title: Old video of 21-yr-old Rishi Sunak saying he doesn't have working-class friends goes viral
385.article_body: An old video of 21-year-old Rishi Sunak saying he does not have working-class friends has resurfaced and gone viral after he announced his candidacy for the UK Prime Minister. "I have friends who are aristocrats, I have friends who are upper-class, I have friends who are, you know, working-class. Well, not working class," Sunak said in a 2001 BBC documentary.

386.title: Man who helped in supplying weapons for Moosewala’s murder attacked in jail
386.article_body: Satbir Singh from Amritsar, who was arrested for supplying illegal weapons that were suspected to have been used to kill Sidhu Moosewala, was attacked inside Ludhiana Central Jail. "He said that he is unable to identify [the attackers]. He has suffered minor injuries on his head and legs. We have started investigation to identify the attackers," an official said.

387.title: Tar balls with garbage wash ashore the coast of Juhu beach in Mumbai
387.article_body: Tar balls with garbage washed ashore the coast of Juhu beach in Mumbai, reports said. This comes amid heavy rains that have been lashing Mumbai as part of ongoing monsoon season in the city. Meanwhile, amid rainfall in the city, a campaign against potholes has been started in Mumbai and 'Get Well Soon' cards are being sent to BMC chief.

388.title: If I had to pick a T20 side, Virat wouldn't be there: Ajay Jadeja
388.article_body: Former India cricketer Ajay Jadeja has said Team India captain Rohit Sharma has to take a call about the team's approach in upcoming games. Jadeja further suggested that Rohit will probably have better options than Virat Kohli if they want to follow this attacking template. "If I had to pick a T20 side, Virat probably wouldn't be there," stated Jadeja.

389.title: When I looked for projects, people were busy getting on magazine covers: Urmila
389.article_body: Actress Urmila Matondkar said that she was always too busy being an actor than being a star. "Running to parties and doing PR stunts was never on my list. Till date, I have no PR...When I was looking for projects that were a notch higher than my previous work, people were busy getting on magazine covers," she added.

390.title: Ensure cows are not slaughtered on Bakri Eid: Maha Speaker to DGP
390.article_body: Maharashtra Assembly Speaker Rahul Narwekar wrote to state DGP, Rajnish Seth, instructing him that the police should ensure that cows are not slaughtered on the day of Bakri Eid on July 10. Earlier, Karnataka Animal Husbandry Minister Prabhu Bhamla Chavan urged people to not slaughter cattle for Bakri Eid and warned stern action against offenders.

391.title: Jacqueline shares 1st poster of her H'wood film, says 'Proud to be part of it'
391.article_body: Actress Jacqueline Fernandez has shared the first poster of her upcoming Hollywood film. The anthology, titled 'Tell It Like a Woman', has been directed by eight women filmmakers from different parts of the world. "So proud to be part of this extraordinary effort by the entire team of 'Tell It Like a Woman'," Jacqueline wrote while sharing the poster.

392.title: Will try to bring 'achhe din' in lives of common citizens: Maharashtra CM
392.article_body: Maharashtra CM Eknath Shinde on Saturday said he will use his CM’s post to give justice to the people of the state and will try to bring "achhe din" in common citizens' lives. "We will take forward the Hindutva of Balasaheb and teachings of Dharmveer Anand Dighe," Shinde added. He was addressing a public gathering in Pune.

393.title: Mumbai man gets cheated of ₹4.68 lakh by woman he befriended on dating app
393.article_body: A 23-year-old Mumbai-based man filed a complaint with Bhandup Police claiming that the woman he befriended through a dating app extorted ₹4.68 lakh from him. According to the victim, the woman made a video call to him and got indulged in obscene activity. The woman allegedly recorded the whole act and later threatened the man to share it on internet.

394.title: I was the first boy in my family to pass Class 10, got 53.4%: Ranbir Kapoor
394.article_body: Actor Ranbir Kapoor, in a recent interview, revealed that he was the first boy in his family to pass Class 10. He revealed that he got 53.4%. "When my results came, my family was so happy that they kept a huge party for me. They had no expectations," the actor, who will be next seen in 'Shamshera', added.

395.title: Arjun Rampal shares pics with girlfriend Gabriella on four-year anniversary
395.article_body: Actor Arjun Rampal took to Instagram to share a few pictures with his girlfriend Gabriella Demetriades to mark four years of their relationship. "Happy 4th to us my love. Thank you for all the beautiful memories. To making many more. #4thanniversary," he wrote. Several celebrities, including Bobby Deol, Abhishek Kapoor and Divya Dutta, posted congratulatory comments on the post.

396.title: Due to political opportunism, rift being created between communities: Amartya Sen
396.article_body: A rift is being created between communities on account of “political opportunism”, Nobel laureate Amartya Sen said on Saturday. "There is an effort to divide Indians…create a rift in the co-existence of Hindus and Muslims on account of political opportunism," Sen added. His statement came during a virtual address at the centenary celebration of ‘Anandabazar Patrika’.

397.title: Japan makes online insults punishable by one year in prison or fine
397.article_body: Japan's parliament has passed legislation making online insults punishable by imprisonment amid rising concerns regarding social media abuse. Offenders convicted of online insults can now be jailed for up to one year or fined 300,000 yen. The law came after reality TV celebrity Hana Kimura died after receiving online abuse from people on social media.

398.title: Don't want Alia to sacrifice her dreams after having a child: Ranbir
398.article_body: Actor Ranbir Kapoor said he does not want his wife and actress Alia Bhatt to sacrifice her dreams because she going to have a child. "Alia and I have been talking about it for some time now, how we're going to share our responsibilities...how we're going to share our time," he added. Alia announced her pregnancy on Instagram in June.

399.title: Uma Bharti writes to BJP chief Nadda against MP's new liquor policy
399.article_body: BJP leader and ex-CM of Madhya Pradesh Uma Bharti wrote to party President JP Nadda urging him to ensure that action is taken against Madhya Pradesh government's new liquor policy. "I do not go against party's set of rules, but I do not compromise with subjects that are related with my faith," Bharti said in her letter.

400.title: List of state-wise active COVID-19 cases released
400.article_body: The Union Health Ministry on Sunday informed that at present there are 1,28,690 active COVID-19 cases in India, with Kerala accounting for the maximum number of active cases at 28,571. This is followed by West Bengal (21,159), Tamil Nadu (18,842), Maharashtra (18,672), Karnataka (6,693), Telangana (5,189), Gujarat (4,046), Odisha (2,504), Uttar Pradesh (2,265), and Delhi (2,264).
